Job Description:
AK Steel has an immediate opportunity for an Electrical Maintenance Engineer - Steelmaking at our Middletown facility.

Primary Responsibilities:
Responsible for the complete design of electrical systems for upgrades to new and existing equipment.
Responsible for the electrical system concepts, drawing development, equipment specification, system control concepts and flow diagrams.
Project supervision for electrical portion of systems purchased from outside mechanical and/or electrical equipment suppliers.
Responsible for all required programming, installation design, start-up, and final documentation.
On a day-to-day basis include technical support of maintenance in troubleshooting equipment breakdowns.
Responsible for Power Distribution from Medium Voltage Substations and 480 Volt Substations to distributed Motor Control Centers and the loads they feed.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering is required.
At least 3 years experience in a heavy industrial environment.
Co-op or related experience in system design, programming, and startup of industrial equipment.
Experience should include but not be limited to programming and implementation of Programmable Logic Controllers, AC/DC motor drives, Human Machine Interface, and industrial component networking.
Experience with Rockwell/Allen Bradley PLC, Siemens S7 PLC, and/or Siemens and Rockwell AC/DC drives.
Experience in the steelmaking process is beneficial.
AutoCAD experience is preferred.
Experience with 250 VDC motor control and overhead crane controls is beneficial.
Why Apply?
Excellent compensation and benefits.
Challenging work.
Advancement opportunities.

Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY

Perform engineering duties in planning, designing, developing, testing and supervising the manufacture and installation of electrical equipment, components, or systems for custom industrial HVAC/refrigeration equipment.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Reasonable Accommodations Statement

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Essential Functions Statement(s)
Read and interpret technical drawings, schematics, specifications and computer-generated reports in order to research, design and evaluate electrical products, equipment, systems and processes to meet customer requirements, applying knowledge of engineering principles.
Specify system components or direct selection of products to ensure conformance with engineering design and performance specifications.
Prepare and study technical drawings, specifications of electrical systems to ensure that design, installation and operations conform to standards and customer requirements.
Operate computer-assisted engineering and design software and equipment to perform engineering tasks.
Confer with engineers, customers, and others to discuss existing or potential engineering projects and products.
Direct and coordinate manufacturing, construction, installation, maintenance, support, documentation, and testing activities to ensure compliance with specifications, codes, and customer requirements.
Design, implement, maintain, and improve electrical instruments, equipment, facilities, components, products, and systems for commercial, industrial, and domestic purposes.
Prepare specifications for purchase of materials and equipment.
Perform detailed calculations to compute and establish manufacturing, construction, and installation standards and specifications.
Investigate customer complaints, determine nature and extent of problem, and recommend remedial measures.
Assist with project production efforts to assure projects are completed satisfactorily, on time and within budget.
Plan and implement research methodology and procedures to apply principles of electrical theory to engineering projects.
Assist with development of budgets, estimating labor, material, and construction costs.
Compile data and write reports regarding existing and potential engineering studies and projects.
Train project team members as necessary.
Investigate and test vendors' and competitors' products.
Inspect completed installations and observe operations to ensure conformance to design and equipment specifications and compliance with operational and safety standards.
Conduct field surveys and study maps, graphs, diagrams, and other data to identify and correct power system problems.
Collect data relating to commercial and residential development, population, and power system interconnection to determine operating efficiency of electrical systems.
Assist with shop testing of units.
Assist with unit start-up as required at job sites.
Attendance at work during regularly scheduled shifts and scheduled overtime is an essential duty. This includes but is not limited to being at the work station ready for work at the start of the shift.
Other responsibilities as assigned.
MiTek is an E-Verify and Drug and Tobacco-Free Workplace.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard To race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Required Skills

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS

Competency Statement(s)
Accuracy - Ability to perform work accurately and thoroughly.
Analytical Skills - Ability to use thinking and reasoning to solve a problem.
Conceptual Thinking - Ability to think in terms of abstract ideas.
Detail Oriented - Ability to pay attention to the minute details of a project or task.
Technical Aptitude - Ability to comprehend complex technical topics and specialized information.
Research Skills - Ability to design and conduct a systematic, objective, and critical investigation.
Safety Awareness - Ability to identify and correct conditions that affect employee safety.
Communication - Ability to communicate effectively with others verbally and in writing.
Computer Skills

Microsoft Office Suite, Autocad, Outlook, related software skills.

Required Experience

Education : Bachelor degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience required.

Experience : One to two years related experience strongly preferred.

Job Location
Minnetonka, US-MN

Title:

Senior Electrical Engineer

FLSA Status:

Exempt
Position Description
The successful applicant will provide electrical engineering expertise for Ideal Aerosmiths products and testing solutions. Typical areas of focus include servo systems, analog and digital logic as well as general system integration. While not being an expert in all areas of the product, the successful electrical engineer will have a working knowledge on how the electrical system interacts with the mechanical and software portions of the product. The position also requires the ability to work with minimal supervision, start projects with minimal parameters, complete assignments accurately and on schedule, excellent troubleshooting skills, and the ability bring out the best in other team members.
Job Responsibilities
Apply principles and practices of electrical engineering to design the electrical system for the Ideal Aerosmith product.
Prepare technical drawings and specifications for the electrical system components.
Develop and coordinate test procedures to ensure operation of equipment meets quality standards, regulations and customer requirements.
Confer with engineers, product management, customers, and management to discuss existing or future engineering products and projects.
Provide electrical expertise to the integration team and to customer support as needed.
Provide estimates for labor, material, and other costs for quotes and timeline development.
Participate and lead within the guidelines of the Entrepreneurial Operation System
Ensure compliance with ISO 9001 and other regulatory standards.
Qualification Requirements
BS or equivalent in Electrical Engineering.
10 years of electrical engineering design experience.
Ability to travel (domestic and internationally) and obtain a passport.
This position requires the employee to work in a restricted facility that requires US citizenship or Permanent Residence (Green Card).
Skill Requirements
Possess skills and knowledge in the following areas of Mechatronics:
Motors/Drives
Feedback Devices
Control Systems
Electrical Hardware/Software Integration
Industrial Controls/PLCs and Power Systems
Embedded Systems
Electromagnetic Compatibility
Experience with PCB design
Familiarity with compliance testing. (NRTL, CE)
Capability in troubleshooting data transmission circuits (Ethernet, USB, CAN, etc.)
Knowledge with programming languages like C/C++, C#, Java, etc.
Experience with MATLAB and Simulink
Ability to effectively troubleshoot electrical systems.
Excellent problem solving, interpersonal, communication and conflict management skills.
Physical Requirements
Must have the ability to lift and/or carry 45 lbs.
Ability to work for extended periods at computer workstation.
The position can require walking, standing, squatting, crouching, stooping, lifting, climbing, pulling, pushing, sitting, repetitive motion and kneeling.

POSITION SUMMARY
We provide our utility clients with a wide range of energy-saving and renewable energy solutions. From individual utility customers and construction contractors, to utilities, municipalities, and government bodies, our clients have come to depend on our customized energy efficiency programs to help them to meet their energy saving goals.
The Energy Engineer is primarily responsible for providing expert technical support to customers and trade allies. In this role, you will provide energy advice and coordination services for the energy efficiency programs; these services include: building maintenance, lighting, controls, heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) systems for energy efficiency and comfort. This is a client-facing role in which you will interact with and provide customers with advice and recommendations on the solutions that best suit their needs. You will also be working with others who are passionate about energy efficiency and making a positive impact on the industry.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
This list of duties and responsibilities is not all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities, as management may deem necessary from time to time.
Work with business and building owners, developers, architects, engineers and contractors to provide energy efficiency advice and assistance in participating energy efficiency or energy conservation programs
Identify and provide documentation of on-site opportunities for energy efficiency in buildings under design and construction; provide follow-up as required to the customers
Participate in QA/QC and internal audit activities
Analyze building utility bills to determine energy usage trends
Understand and implement the company’s Sales Process, including but not limited to;
Making outbound calls to new and existing customers to meet assigned energy saving targets
Managing field time effectively with customer or Trade Ally visits
Developing and presenting program presentations to spur project activity
Responding to customer inquiries and concerns by phone, electronically or in person to move projects towards completion
Ability to promote, sell and influence property managers, owners and maintenance staff to install energy efficiency measures in multifamily dwellings
Prepare and present reports and presentations
Discuss technical elements of energy consuming equipment in a facility (lighting, HVAC, hot water systems, envelope, integrated design) and how it affects utility consumption and demand, to help build a business case to prioritize recommendations and how they affect savings and first cost
Enter data into spreadsheets and databases to determine energy savings and to manage current projects, collaborate with other Energy Advisors/Energy Engineers as required to maximize technical support to the client base
Develop a comprehensive understanding of the program’s strategic direction regarding energy efficiency and the business activities of its customers
Keeping current on the latest energy-saving technology and how we might incorporate them into our products
Collaborating with other Energy Advisors and Energy Engineers to maximize client technical support
Serve as a technical resource for Energy Advisors
Ensure compliance with all quality and safety policies as well as all OSHA regulations
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering from an accredited four-year college or university. (Based on the position preferences may include: Mechanical, Civil, Electrical or Industrial Engineering)
1-3 years engineering experience related to mechanical design, energy modeling or construction
1-2 years of experience in the energy efficiency industry
Experience in building design, “green” construction and sustainable design - Preferred
Certified Energy Manager and the LEED AP credentials – Preferred
CEM or VPI certification - Preferred
PE or FE certification or desire to obtain one - Preferred
A licensed engineer – Preferred
Strong understanding of how systems affect energy consumptio
Required Skills, Knowledge and Abilities
Strong customer service and communication skills
Must be able to handle a wide work variety and work in a fast-paced environment
Must be a self-starter, organized and have an ability to prioritize workload
Ability to identify and resolve project application issues with customers and trade allies
Proficient in Microsoft Office, specifically Word, Excel and Outlook
Strong data entry skills in entering information in tracking systems/databases
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing with customers, clients and employees
Ability to analyze and interpret data and solve practical problems
Knowledge of mathematical concepts such as fractions, percentages and ratios
Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions
Ability to understand and apply in a building environment applied physics including thermodynamics, fluids and heat transfer theory
Must be able to research questions of a technical nature efficiently and find new information
Reliable transportation

Licenses & Certifications
Valid driver’s license
Travel Requirements
Willingness to travel less than 25-50% or more of the time

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT
Required to sit, stand, walk; talk and hear; and ability to touch and handle tools and/or controls
Ability to lift up to 40 pounds
Noise Level is typically moderate
Employee could be exposed to fumes and/or airborne particles and risk of potential shock

Note: Reasonable accommodations may be made for individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.
The above information describes the general duties and requirements necessary to perform the principle functions of the position. This shall not be construed as a detailed description of all the duties and requirements that may be necessary in this position.
An Equal Opportunity Employer

The Electrical Design Engineer is responsible for design of battery energy storage systems (BESS), sometimes coupled with utility scale wind and solar energy installations, with emphasis on utility interconnection and medium voltage (12-35kV) design.
This position requires strong working knowledge of electrical engineering design principles, industry standards and local electric codes.
The Electrical Design Engineer is expected to work within experienced teams and execute projects in conformance with customer requirements and applicable codes. The person will develop detailed diagrams and drawings, create bill of materials, develop equipment specifications, perform design calculations, participate in system installation, and assist with project on site testing.

Primary Responsibilities:
Provide medium voltage design expertise to the design team, creating project drawings, block diagrams, line diagrams and component specifications.
Review and analyze specifications, industry standards and local codes.
Create preliminary design documents in support of new business conquest.
Perform electrical calculations and simulations in support of the electrical design and component specification (capacity and voltage calculations, conductor and fuse sizing, inverter and converter characteristics, electrical panels, metering, switches, etc.).
Create project electrical drawings (main level, sub-system, main circuit, control circuit, physical and logical, cables set, cable and device tables).
Participate in installation of various battery energy system components.
Execute test plans in the lab and in the field.
Support component factory acceptance testing and on-site commissioning.
Coordinate with clients, utilities, partners, contractors and suppliers.
Work closely with other disciplines including application and mechanical engineers, developers, architects, utilities and contractors.

Position Qualifications:
S. in Electrical Engineering.
Minimum 3 years of electric power design of medium voltage electrical distribution systems.
Knowledge of NEC codes, IEEE, UL and ANSI standards, Grid codes in North America and Europe.
Experience with BESS development preferred.
Working knowledge of reading construction and electrical drawings and specifications.
Knowledge of dimensioning, design and protection of transformers and medium voltage switchgears.
Hands on experience with installing, connecting and testing electrical components.
Experience with smart devices communication protocol (CAN, Modbus).
Excellent English written and verbal communication skills, ability to write detailed specifications and technical reports.
Ability to travel up to 50% of the time.
Must have a strong work ethic, positive attitude, and be able to work in a team environment.

Who we are:

Conti Enterprises is a fourth generation, privately owned construction leader specializing in infrastructure projects. We are known for our platform of outstanding project execution. Our track record of delivering high impact construction projects to our clients and our extraordinary commitment to our core values, employees, and communities where we work has been the foundation of our success and longevity. What we are looking for:

Driven and motivated Project Engineer for Charleston, SC area.

The Project Engineer works with the Project Team and our Field Management to construct a safe and quality project, while beating the estimate budgets, improving the total Operating Profit margin over the original bid, and building a strong customer relationship.
This position is responsible for subcontractor management, submittals, buyouts, great client relations and provides administrative oversight to the project team.

Responsibilities
Develops various construction means and methods with the Superintendent and/or Project Manager to optimize safety, cost, equipment utilization, schedule efficiency, and communication with the client.

Monitors material yields and modifies operations to minimize waste.
Leads the buyout process, writes the requisition, and communicates all required information to the Project Team.
Assists the preparation of the 12 month cash flow schedule
Reviews and understands the extra work billing format. Updates all budgets to incorporate owner change orders.
Oversees subcontractors and holds the subcontractors accountable to their agreement. Attends the subcontractor coordination meetings to provide updates to schedules, drawings, and specifications.
Produces and manages project submittals, shop drawings, and material certifications so all are submitted and approved prior to the start of work.

Establishes excellent working and professional relationships with the clients and their representatives and/or field inspectors.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Construction Management or related field with 3+ years of relevant experience or equivalent.
Heavy Civil Construction experience is required
Experience with pile driving, shoring and concrete work is preferred
Excellent teamwork, communication and people skills a must.
Has a solid time management system and demonstrates excellent organizational skills.
Working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, P6, HCSS and ERP systems.
Working knowledge of estimating, engineering, cost tracking systems and site surveying a plus

Conti has great benefits. We provide medical, dental and vision on the first day of your employment. Life insurance, 401(k) matching plan, EAP, wellness programs and many other optional programs are offered as well.

Nick Falcone & Sons began in 1945, in West Philadelphia by Nick Falcone Sr. He started the business in residential concrete, new developments, flat concrete and curb work.

In 1960, Nick Falcone Jr. and his brother John continued the business and expanded into heavy highway and concrete roadway paving. At this time Nick Falcone & Sons was working with various heavy highway contractors and large home builders in the Tri-state area.

During the late 1970’s, the company thrived on commercial, new residential developments, and heavy highway work. Nick Falcone & Sons at this time was one of the largest concrete companies in Southeastern Pennsylvania.

In 1986, the ownership changed to the third generation, Nick III, Greg, and Jim Falcone. With continued success, the business expanded into Municipal work and complete site development. Nick Falcone & Sons is fortunate to employ a dedicated group of loyal, honest, and extremely knowledgeable people. With this advantage, we continue to provide a strong emphasis on high quality workmanship and service; our commitment for decades.

Development of electrical simulations that show a path of compliance toward meeting customer performance requirements.

Review of existing products to determine if a customer solution already exists within the business.

Leading within a cross-functional environment to define the needs and develop solutions to meet customer requirements within the boundaries of the project.
Test oversight to ensure that performance is met as defined by the project.

Entering manufacturing and design data as necessary for production build within existing ERP system.

Basic Mechanical Engineering understanding to assess strengths and weaknesses of existing and new products.
Basic Rotor dynamics understanding for the determination of limits of rotating components such as shafts and bearings, including natural frequency and deflection at speed and temperature.
Knowledge of material sciences to confirm strengths and weaknesses of parts.

Analytical motor performance calculators, preferably RMxprt.

Mentoring, training and development activities by industry experts abound, while the nature of the business encourages cross-functional and interdepartmental learning, communication and teamwork that lead to continuous improvement in all areas. Desired competencies include self-motivation, creative problem-solving, compulsion to make a difference and the ability to work well with others in a challenging, fast-paced environment.
This role has overall project responsibility for assigned transformer designs. S/he will design the electrical components of new transformers and make improvements to existing transformers, while providing guidance to mechanical and controls designers to ensure compliance with specifications and industry standards. S/he may evaluate products, parts, or processes for cost efficiency and reliability. This individual must possess entry-level problem-solving skills. S/he follows standard engineering practices to develop optimum designs, making minor adjustments as necessary to achieve the best results.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

• Review designs and evaluate for complexity, reliability, ease of manufacture, and profitability.
• Participate in product electrical design work
• Design process requires the correct interpretation and application of customer requirements, industry standards, design and manufacturing standards to insure that designs meet our customer requirements at an agreed upon level of performance and reliability
• Review design results and provide feedback where necessary in order to effectively support marketing schedules and insure that designs meet performance and cost objectives.
• Correctly interpret the product scope to insure proper application of the transformer products.
• Remain current with industry and technical developments and maintain a high level of expertise in designated areas of specialization.
• Maintain designated design, manufacturing and process related documentation.
• Consult with marketing and design engineering staff to understand solutions to meet customer needs.
• Consult with manufacturing process leaders to develop and optimize design solutions at the optimum total cost.
• Participate in the development of design system improvements. May act as design department liaison with other support functions such as IT, operations, etc. Assist in training of junior engineers.
• Product application principles and understanding of specific application requirements.
• Current knowledge of related technology (e.g. - heat transfer, magnetic, dielectrics, and materials).
• Strong foundation in basic tenants of product technology, including mechanical design and product testing

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

• Excellent process and problem solving skills
• Solid Business Acumen to create and implement programs that support business strategy
• Ability to guide & lead non-technical personnel to technical solutions
• Proven track record of meeting commitments with the highest standards of ethics and integrity
• An excellent team player with strong people skills; able to build relationships at all levels of the organization
• Effective communication skills, including verbal (logical and organized), written, listening and presentation
• Computer skills: highly proficient in Microsoft applications: Power Point, Excel and Word
• Analytical capacity for creative problem-solving, process design and product application, design and development
• Data collection and analysis skills
• Understanding of and skill in use of specific design methods, rationales and tools (e.g. FEA, DFM, robust design)
• Understanding of industry standards and practices

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Required Education / Experience
• Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering
• 5-7 years of related experience

About SPX

SPX Transformer Solutions, Inc. (formerly Waukesha Electric Systems, Inc), is one of the largest U.S. manufacturers of power transformers and a valued supplier of complete transformer service solutions, components and replacement parts as well as a variety of substation-applicable training classes for all skill levels including a large number of comprehensive LTC maintenance courses. We employ approximately 1,200 people throughout the United States and operate manufacturing facilities at our headquarters location in Waukesha, WI as well as Goldsboro, NC and Dallas, TX.

SPX is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, or any other reason prohibited by applicable law.

Thank you for your interest in our company.

Job Description:
AK Steel has an immediate opportunity for an Electrical Maintenance Engineer at our Middletown facility. The Electrical Maintenance Engineer will maintain the drive and control systems. This will include troubleshooting and project work.

Primary Responsibilities:
Maintain the drive and control systems for the area assigned. Develop and maintain system preventative/predictive maintenance schedules.
Lead and assist in system troubleshooting and repairs. Work with maintenance staff to determine the root cause of all electrical failures and develop/implement solutions to stop recurrence.
Provide troubleshooting support to electrical technicians after normal working hours when needed.
Develop understanding of existing PLC programs on all equipment. Program and implement PLC modifications as corrective actions to prevent recurrence of issues.
Maintain and improve electrical documentation.
Develop long and short term plans for equipment improvements.
Assist in planning equipment outages and upgrades. Assist maintenance service provider and contractors during these plans.
Work with contractors and vendors to implement large projects. Develop cost, benefits, plans for installation, and training needs.
Other duties as assigned.

Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or Electrical Engineering Technology degree is required.
At least 3 years experience with control systems and PLCs.
Experience with all types of drive systems including tuning and troubleshooting AC VFD and SCR controls.
PLC design, programming, installation, and troubleshooting experience. Rockwell Contrologix or Siemens PLC Series 5/7 is a plus.
HMI programming and maintenance experience. Experience with Intellution is preferred.
Field service, troubleshooting, and continuous improvement project experience.
Must be able to work in a 24/7 environment.

Job Description:
Job Summary

The Electrical Foreman functions effectively as the site manager for projects that he/she is running. The basic function of the Foreman is to motivate, drive, and manage his/her team to ensure assigned tasks are completed within the allotted time frame and budget. Additionally, the foreman is responsible for acting as an administrator and coordinated to provide the necessary planning, organization, direction, communication and control between the various internal and external parties that impact the timing and profitability of assigned projects. The Electrical Foreman is an essential component to the Capitol Valley Electric Management Team!

Responsibilities and Duties
Ensure that all assigned staff are working with a sense of urgency, while also maintaining quality and safety
Responsible for familiarization with the complete scope and proposed method of construction for all assigned projects
Responsible for coordination of Capitol Valley Electric's field personnel and sub-contractors with other contractors on-site to ensure timely job completion
Responsible for Quality Assurance on all assigned projects
Develops and implements plans for managing time, materials, and manpower
Maintain professional and productive relations with General Contractors, Owners, Sub Contractors, and all others associated with the project
Responsible for timely and accurate daily and weekly reporting
Ensures that all internal field employees are adhering to Capitol Valley Electric's safety policies
Participates in in-depth project pre-planning and detailing
Maintains accurate time tracking for assigned field employees
Performs Electrician duties as needed in a manner which clearly sets the standard for assigned employees to follow
Responsible for creating and submitting material requisitions
Works closely with internal office personnel to ensure administrative needs are completed in a timely, accurate, and legal manner
Provides an objective viewpoint of each project and reports to the Superintendent on the progress of the project
Is aware of the general job site morale and initiates whatever procedures necessary to improve and maintain at an acceptable level
Qualifications and Skills
Valid CA General Electrician License
Valid CA Drivers License
3-5 years of experience in Electrical Sub-contractor supervision
5-8 years of experience in Commercial or Multi-Family electrical construction
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills
Must have moderate skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook
Physical requirements include sitting, standing, walking, bending, kneeling, and use of hands and arms to operate equipment. Must have a strong sense of balance and no fear of heights. Must be able to lift and move up to 75 lbs.
Benefits
Top Hourly wages paid weekly
Medical and Dental Insurance
401 K with 100% company match up to 4%of salary (after 1 year of service)
Five days of paid time off (after 1 year of service)
Quarterly incentive plan base on the profitability of the project
Truck, FastTrac, Gas Card

Job Responsibilities

Use a CAD system to generate designs and documentation; Uses computer assisted engineering software to design and evaluate mechanical designs. Develop multiple design concepts and present to peers.
Create and modify working samples as required in metal shop, test lab, prototype lab or similar environment.
Develop automation systems to reduce production costs and lead time to market and improve the quality of the products.
Cultivates Continuous Improvement. Research and seeks ways to increase productivity. This includes the aspects such as better tooling/techniques, the use of ergonomics, software implementation as well as personal growth through motivation, teaching and training.

Ability to communicate effectively with all departments and cross functional teams
Experience in Industrial product design and tooling design

Ability to gather input from production personnel through team implementation of process improvements on the production floor.
Ability to understand and apply FMEA, RCA, Cpk and gage R&R analysis for manufacturing processes preferred

Lean and Six Sigma experience preferred

SUMMARY

Matrix Technologies is looking for an energetic and customer focused engineer who would like to be part of a team environment. The Electrical Power Engineer will perform electrical engineering tasks with little or no supervision required. This position may lead a team of 2-4 engineers and designers on multiple projects. Eligible candidates will possess experience with electrical power system design and analysis.

SPECIFICATIONS

Eligible candidates will possess the following:
Legally eligible to work in the United States
Bachelor or Master of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering from an ABET accredited college or university
Minimum of 6-8 years of electrical engineering experience
Preferred Industry experience: Food & Beverage, Refinery, Steel, Automotive, Specialty Chemicals, Oil and Gas
Professional Engineering (PE) license preferred
ADDITIONAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS
Facilities electrical experience including the design of electrical service, lighting, receptacle, and grounding systems
Experience with low and medium voltage electrical system design

Experience with protective device coordination and arc flash analysis is preferred
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite software
Excellent oral and written communication
Team oriented
Strong leadership ability with the desire to take on potential management role
Experience in writing project construction specifications and preparing bid packages
Ability to travel
Project Management experience demonstrating effective implementation experience with Work Breakdown Structures and other tracking systems.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, sit, use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk, and hear.
Specific vision abilities by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
This position must also be able to perform industrial field work which may include hazardous locations, ladders, and stairs.

Our talented staff and processes have also earned us a spot in the Control Engineering System Integrator Hall of Fame.

Description
Simply Put, A Great Place to Work


Alfred Benesch & Company (Benesch) is a growing, multi-disciplined engineering and professional services firm. Water\wastewater treatment plants, municipal facilities, schools, parks, and airports are just a few examples of where you can find our work. We enhance infrastructure and communities across the country – creating spaces and providing connections in ways that make a difference.

As a mid-sized firm, we pride ourselves on being nimble enough to remain responsive to client needs, yet large enough to offer exceptional bench strength. As a member of our team, you’ll have an opportunity to draw from those resources when you need them, and likewise, contribute your expertise when you have something to share. Our comprehensive benefits package includes paid over-time, exceptional retirement fund contributions, flexible schedules, wellness incentives and all-around great people to work with. Take your career to the next level by applying today. You’ll like it here. It’s a great place to work.

Electrical Project Engineer – Detroit, MI


The ideal candidate will have experience in the design, construction, and start-up of power, control and process instrumentation systems for water, wastewater, and stormwater pump stations, industrial campuses and facilities including implementation of computer control and data collection at primary and remote facilities. Electrical power experience to include the power distribution and protection of switchgear, motors/motor control centers, electrical panels, surge protection, transformers, medium voltage looped systems, and low voltage systems for municipal, commercial and industrial facilities. Also, experience in short circuit, protective coordination and arc flash studies using Paladin DesignBase software is a plus.

You Will Be Responsible For:
Ensuring completeness of the electrical design and deployment/delivery details
Managing the process of compiling and coordinating plans, cost estimates, and pay items
Developing and reviewing cost estimates as well as monitoring and comparing to client expectations
Coordinating and/or reviewing drafting and assembly of plan set
Overseeing layout and/or reviewing drawings for a project
Assembling competent project communications, including meeting minutes, technical documents and complete reports that require little editing and meet the client expectations
Assuming responsibility for project design calculation files and assuring adequate independent quality control reviews on that work
Checking and signing off on electrical design calculations and plan elements prior to Quality Assurance
Assuming responsibility and ownership of the assigned project components
Developing project electrical design criteria for the assigned project components
Assuring compliance with project CADD standards
Understanding and monitoring the overall required scope and schedule for the project deliverables.
Identifying deficiencies and proposing corrective action

At the core of every successful company, you’ll find a great team. Our team is truly a family and the heart and soul of the company. With a Purpose to“make tomorrow a little bit better than today” for each other, our customers, and our communities, we work together to create an environment where you can love what you do and be your best every day as you write yourself into the Lube-Tech story. And that’s one of the reasons we are the proud recipient of the 2019 Top Workplace award, issued by the Minneapolis Star Tribune!

We promise to:

Provide a safe environment: We care about each other, and it’s a top priority to ensure we all go home to our families without an incident.

Celebrate what makes us unique: We look for greatness in everyone, listen to every voice, and find ways to bring out the best in each other.

Empower each other: We trust each other and create a place where everyone matters and can make a difference.

Since 1925, Lube-Tech and its founding companies have demonstrated a people-first, customer-focused approach. Lube-Tech is a family-owned company who provides advanced energy, fluid technology, lubricants and services to OEMs and customers within the automotive, fleet and manufacturing industries. Lube-Tech also operates Reliable Plus, a vehicle wash company who provides product and service solutions to customers within the c-store, grocery, fleet and automotive industries.

Role Overview:

The Automation and Controls Engineer is a pivotal role in ensuring the success and the efficiency of the systems that allow us to deliver the best quality product to our customers. This role will be responsible for supporting the control systems and equipment for Lube-Tech’s multiple facilities. Through the support of our Engineering and Operations team, this role will scope, design, and manage capital projects. These projects may include system design, control and machine specifications, troubleshooting of equipment, and continuous improvement.

Role Qualifications& Skills:
Controls& Automation
Maintain the control systems for our production facilities including equipment and programming.
Troubleshoot and repair equipment control problems
Build and maintain equipment and control systems vendor relationships
Work with the engineering team on design of new systems including calculations, material specifications, layouts, equipment, and facility upgrade recommendations.
Works on continuous improvement processes
Project Management
Ensures all projects are completed on-time and within project budget
Lead capital project across the enterprise by managing project scope, budget, and schedule
Work with the engineering team on design of new systems including calculations, material specifications, layouts, equipment, and facility upgrade.
Demonstrates and promotes enterprise safety policies.
Collaboration& Communication
Works together and provides communication on projects, equipment, etc. with operations, maintenance, and management.
Collaborate with functional leaders and team significant equipment and facility improvement acquisitions
Ability to present project information concisely and with clear communication to executive leadership.
Works with environmental, health and safety team, regarding project compliance, tasks and overall plant operations.
Travel
This role is posted in both Golden Valley, MN and/or Shreveport, LA
If candidate is in Shreveport, LA travel will be 25% dependent on projects
If candidate is in Golden Valley, MN travel will be 30% - 40% dependent on projects
Education: Bachelor's degree in Electrical, Mechanical, or Industrial Engineering.

Experience/Training:
2 - 5+ years of experience with automation/controls and production equipment automation including programming
Strong knowledge of engineering principles, including but not limited to structural, machine design.
Experience with 2D and 3D CAD software
Proficiency in the use of MS office applications
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Demonstrated leadership organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Willing to be“hands on” and dig in as needed
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit, stand, walk, use hands, handle, or touch objects, tools, or controls. Good vision is required for inspecting parts and equipment. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. The ability to focus while working near production equipment and other distractions.
Office and warehouse environment. High temperatures, especially in the summer in both the warehouse and tank farm. Employee may need to work off elevated heights in a scissor lift on occasion.
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

We are always working to ensure our teammates know just how valued they are. In addition to a competitive salary, comprehensive health and wellness benefits beginning day one, Lube-Tech offers employees a variety of perks, including:

Philanthropy– Giving back to our communities is woven into the fabric of who we are. Throughout the year, there are many opportunities for employees, and their families, to get involved and give back. The Employee Giving Program allows you to donate to a 501c3 nonprofit of your choice and the Bame Foundation will match your contribution, dollar for dollar!

Total Wellness– Your health and well-being are important to us which is why you’ll have benefit coverage on your first day of employment. Lube-Tech offers employees complimentary use of our onsite fitness facilities where available. In addition to physical wellbeing, Lube-Tech offers a variety of mental health, financial, and other resources to every employee.

Paid Time Off– All employees begin earning paid time off (PTO) upon hire, with the ability to earn 3 weeks of PTO in the first year of employment!

Paid time off when it matters most– We offer paid time off for bereavement& parental leave so you can be with your family when it matters most. We observe eight paid holidays and provide two floating holidays per year.

Profit Sharing– A significant factor in employee engagement is believing you make a difference and have an impact on the success of the company. Lube-Tech has a history of sharing success with teammates through its quarterly Profit-Sharing program.

Dress for your day– We know you’re more productive when you’re comfortable, which is why many roles at Lube-Tech allow for a casual dress work environment. We provide uniforms and personal protective equipment for many roles including drivers, technicians and warehouse.

Lube-Tech is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants including women, minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Job type: Permanent, full-time, Exempt
Engineering Responsibilities:
Create/modify design documents and drawings for a project, including one-line, three-lines, control schematics and wiring diagrams, relay panel arrangements and specifications, conduit and cable sizing/routing and generating bills of material
Design auxiliary AC and DC power systems
Develop SCADA system and communications interfaces
Work with various project teams to fully develop system integration of protection, control and monitoring systems
Perform basic calculations such as relay burden, voltage drop and short circuit calculations
Effectively communicate and coordinate project activities with Project Manager, clients, designers or drafters as needed
Project Management Responsibilities:
Manage projects from beginning to completion- individually responsible for delivering the final product, maintaining quality, creating and managing the project schedule, and creating and maintaining the budget.
Continuous high-quality professional client and internal employee communication on project status.
Following company project processes and procedures throughout the life of the project, which includes, but is not limited to, resourcing, scheduling, and financial reporting.
Travel to client sites for introduction and check-ins based on project needs and project health.
Assisting the project team on any technology or archive access or drawing needs for the project.
Provide timely billing/invoicing information to the Amped I Finance Department.
When needed, management of any subcontractor requirements, which could include, but is not limited to, financial reporting, information handling, and maintenance of third-party schedules.
Communication with Sales Team on all necessary aspects of the project for continual project health and maintenance of client relationships.
Position Requirements:
Ideal candidate will have 8+ years experience however, 6+ years experience in relay protection and control design of high voltage 15-500 kV substations will be considered.
Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited university
Professional engineering license (PE) valued but not required
1+ year(s) experience managing client projects overseeing budgets, resourcing, work flow and being responsible for deliverable dates. Candidates with no project management experience who specialize in high voltage electrical engineering will still be considered for this role but this background is strongly preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to work closely with other engineering and drafting team members to coordinate overall design package requirements
Take personal responsibility for the quality and accuracy of the work product
Interpersonal skills in team-building and excellent verbal/written communication skills
Knowledge of common word processing, spreadsheet and email software

The L.S. Starrett Company, manufacturer of precision tools, located in North Central Mass. is seeking the following position:

Senior Electrical Engineer

The primary responsibilities for this position will be for leading the development and documentation of advanced concepts and designs of complex electronic and electro-mechanical products requiring Analog and Digital Design Skills. In addition, they will be responsible for the construction, test and evaluation of prototype units.

Responsibilities:
Provide conceptual design of complex Electronic and Electro-mechanical products, assemblies and components. Complete tasks according to schedule, budget, costs and design objectives. Monitor and report work progress.
Design and develop firmware, software in support of electronic circuits and test fixtures
Direct the efforts and provide technical guidance for Engineers, Designer, Drafter, Technician and Toolmakers assigned to the project. Coordinate work with Engineers and others to ensure project goals and objectives are met.
Direct the manufacture, test and analysis of prototype units and mockups.
Document work by preparing Schematics, PCB layouts, drawings, Bills of Materials, ECN's and Engineering Release packages. Select and specify tolerances, materials and processes for designs as required. Direct and check the work of draftsmen and technicians as required to ensure accuracy and compliance with Product Requirement Specification and applicable standards. Ensure that quality goals and objectives are met.
Participate in or lead the creation of Engineering Specifications, cost, manpower, capital, and expense estimates, along with task lists, milestones and schedules related to the development of new products.
Participate in or lead product development teams and interface with Manufacturing Engineer, Production, Purchasing, Manufacturing, Vendors, Subcontractors and Customers on issues related to design, manufacture, use of parts or products.
Provide input to maintain documentation, standards and guidelines such as; revision control, libraries, common components, layer lists, database management, etc.
Maintain technical proficiency in design and ECAD skills.
Maintain awareness of competitive products and developments.
Maintain optimum working conditions and housekeeping. Comply with safety rules and regulations.
Assume additional roles and responsibilities as required.
Requirements:
BSEE required, MS preferred; (BSEE acceptable with courses such as Digital and Analog Design and the equivalent of 8 years experience in the design of Instruments, production applications and manufacturing techniques to attain sufficient engineering background.)
Minimum 5 years experience in design and documentation of Instruments with Digital and Analog Circuits and specification of electronic and electro-mechanical components. Experience in compact, very low power (1.5-3VDC) circuit design.
Must be fluent in written and spoken English
Demonstrated skill in the conceptual design and layout of Instruments. Skill in the design and documentation of schematics, PCB Layout, Component Selection, Cables, Wire harnesses etc.
Demonstrated skill in microprocessor based firmware and software development. Must know assembly language, compiliers, installers, and optimization. Preferred platforms PIC and TI MSP 430 chips and C language.
Skilled in the use of ECAD tools for developing schematics and PCB layout (Altium Protel).
Skilled in the use of spreadsheet and word processing tools.
Capable of effectively leading product development teams. Skill in the use of project scheduling tools preferred.
Experience with one or more of the following tools and methods; Design of Experiments, Design For Manufacturability and Assembly (DFMA)
Basic understanding of electro-mechanical design is required.
Works under general direction, independently determines and develops approach to solutions. Work is reviewed for soundness of technical judgment and overall adequacy and accuracy.
The company offers competitive salaries, excellent benefits including Medical, Dental, Life Insurance, STD, LTD, 401(k), Stock Options, Pension, Vacation and more.

Overview:
Want to be part of a customer focused, high performance, high integrity team of technology professionals? At OneNeck IT Solutions we deliver world class IT solutions 365/24/7 for diverse clients across the U.S. We are currently seeking an Engineer – Systems & Storage professional who is passionate about technology and providing best-in-class customer service. This position is located onsite at a client in Newton, IA. Come join and add value to our team!

Responsibilities:
The Engineer - Systems & Storage is responsible for on-site installation, maintenance and repair of company and multi-vendor systems which include hardware, software, and operating systems. This position ensures customer satisfaction by advising on preventive maintenance and configurations which may impact product performance.

The Engineer - Systems & Storage is also responsible for maintaining/increasing knowledge of technologies within specific functional areas, maintaining required certifications, and acting as a “trusted advisor” among our customers on technical matters.

Responsibilities:
Provide technical planning, implementation, configuration, support and troubleshooting services on one or more of product lines or service groups we sponsor.
Analyze complex systems problems and implement solutions. Seek and recommend alternative processes to improve service delivery to the customer in a cost effective way.
Configure, install, and maintain software and hardware. Troubleshoot equipment such as servers, storage, and virtualization technologies.
Create documentation for both internal use and customer deliverables. Produce complete system requirements and/or specifications as appropriate.
Keep up-to-date with changes in technology (i.e. attend conferences or training, complete vendor provided trainings, review/study technical journals)

**NOTE: We can hire this position as an ENGINEER II or III. Requirements for each position are listed in the qualifications section. We will assess applicants based on skills and years of relevant experience.**

Qualifications:
ENGINEER II – SYSTEMS & STORAGE

Associates degree or higher -OR- 2+years professional work experience.
2+ years experience with Windows, VMware and/or Citrix. Experience must include server hardware AND administering systems infrastructure (Servers, Virtualization, Storage, AD, Exchange, SQL, etc.).
Availability to consult, assist and/or perform after-hours support and participate in on-call rotations.
Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license, reliable transportation and insurance.

ENGINEER III – SYSTEMS & STORAGE

Bachelor degree or higher -OR- 4+years professional work experience.
5+ years experience with Windows, VMware and/or Citrix. Experience must include server hardware AND administering systems infrastructure (Servers, Virtualization, Storage, AD, Exchange, SQL, etc.).
Availability to consult, assist and/or perform after-hours support and participate in on-call rotations.
Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license, reliable transportation and insurance.

Other Qualifications:
Experience in MS Azure, MS SCCM and O365, including migrations and greenfield deployments preferred.
Experience in VDI, specifically Citrix, preferred.
Industry standard certifications a plus (MCSE, MCITP, RHCE, ASE, VCP, etc.).
Experience with storage (HPE, Dell/EMC), hardware / blades and Hyper-Convergence (Cisco, HPE, Dell/EMC) a plus.
Sharp technical, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.
Accountable and takes ownership.
Excellent customer service, communications, and professional demeanor.
Able to manage multiple deadlines.
Passionate toward new and existing technologies.
Positive, resourceful, creative and detail-oriented.
Self-starter, able to prioritize appropriately.
Process-oriented.

#OneNeck offers a full suite of IT solutions including cloud and hosting solutions; ReliaCloud® enterprise cloud services; managed services; ERP application management; professional services; IT hardware and more! OneNeck has Tier 3 data centers in Iowa, Minnesota, New Jersey, Wisconsin, Arizona, Oregon and Colorado.

To learn more about this position or our company, please visit oneneck.com.

Bolton & Menk, a top regional consulting firm in the Midwest is looking to add an Electrical Engineer to our team in the Twin Cities. As a Top150 Workplace in Minnesota, this is a fantastic opportunity to work with a great team of professionals.

In this newly added position, you will work on various outdoor projects and will be responsible for the overall electrical design process on roadway, trail, and parking lot lighting, streetscape and accent lighting, recreational fields and buildings, transit station areas, campgrounds, and airports.

We are looking to add an Electrical Engineer who will help foster our mission that All People Should Live in a Safe, Sustainable and Beautiful Community! We are passionate about using collaboration to lead us to the right solution. A solution that can be planned for and funded. A lasting solution that not only works today but long into the future. Our expertise offers a fresh, engaging approach to solve multi-faceted problems involving technical, regulatory, and community issues.

This position can be located out of any of our Twin Cities locations (Chaska, Maplewood, Ramsey, Burnsville or Minneapolis).

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

Manage performance of assigned project team members
Maintain existing client relationships and enhance pursued relationships with clients
Identify, evaluate, pursue, and manage project opportunities
Provide quality control and quality assurance on all project work
Maintain budgets and schedules of project assignments

5+ years of electrical system design experience in the outdoor public infrastructure facilities
Registered as a Professional Engineer in Minnesota, Iowa, and North Dakota or ability to obtain within 6 months

Ability to work remotely and manage projects, clients, and project team members

WHY BOLTON & MENK?

Work with a creative and hardworking team, who believe in client satisfaction and building relationships. For over 70 years Bolton & Menk, Inc. has served public and private clients in the Upper Midwest with comprehensive planning, design and construction engineering and surveying services. The employees at Bolton & Menk are seeking hard working and ambitious co-workers to join us to deliver tomorrow’s leading infrastructure projects. With over 500 employees and 20 offices in Minnesota, Iowa, North Dakota and North Carolina there are always new challenges and career development opportunities available.

Job Title: Electrical Engineer - Motor Control and Hardware
Job Description:
We are looking for an Electrical Engineer who is passionate about solving complex problems while developing awesome battery operated kids’ products. We create product concepts, validate them through rigorous prototyping, and we scrutinize the design and manufacturing details to develop outstanding products. Experience developing electro-mechanical consumer products that found success in the marketplace is a requirement. We are looking for a creative engineer who can bring ideas, solve electro-mechanical challenges, and drive the product into production on schedule, at cost target and with great quality.

Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering
At least 4+ years of engineering electronic consumer products
Demonstrated ability to design and develop electro-mechanical products from concept to production
Responsible for specifying electronic components, electronic hardware and software design, PCB design, firmware programming, defining bill of materials, component cost & project timelines
Solid background in power engineering and controls, including knowledge of motor control and basic sensor principles.
Experience with project management and working with overseas team/vendors
Collaborating with industrial designers and mechanical engineers is key to success
About Us:

To be the World's Most Loved Children's Brand, we need the best people to join our team! Radio Flyer holds a special place in people's hearts. This is true because Radio Flyer transports people to a happy time, to the best parts of childhood, a time when anything was possible. For over 100 years, our company has produced innovative toys that inspire active play, bring smiles and create warm memories that last a lifetime. Beyond our classic Little Red Wagon, Radio Flyer invents and designs some of the most recognizable tricycles, ride-ons, scooters and battery operated vehicles in the industry.

Radio Flyer has consistently been recognized as a top workplace and received numerous awards such as, Fortune’s Best Small & Medium Workplaces, Wall Street Journal’s Top Small Workplaces, the Daily Herald’s Best Places to Work in Illinois, Crain’s Best Places to Work, Entrepreneur and CultureIQ’s Top Company Culture. Radio Flyer is a recognized leader in the toy industry, awarded Toy of the Year, Crain’s most Patents per Capita, and three time award winner of the Chicago Innovation Award. Our global headquarters is in Chicago and we are led by Robert Pasin, grandson of the company founder.

We’re idealists and inventors. Forever tinkering with products and processes, always on the lookout for improvements. A job at Radio Flyer will be demanding. But it also rewards bright, original thinking and hard work. And none of us here would have it any other way.

Above all, the individual must commit to our values:

FUN-omenal Customer Experiences

Live with Integrity

Yes I Can

Excellence in Everything

Responsible for Success

We are looking for people who live our values and support our vision and mission!

At Radio Flyer, we appreciate different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives —encouraging everyone to bring their authentic selves to work. Associate Civil Engineer - Water/ Wastewater

Kjeldsen, Sinnock & Neudeck (KSN) seeks an Associate Civil Engineer Water/Wastewater Engineer with a minimum of 10 years of experience in water/wastewater engineering for our West Sacramento office. The ideal candidate would provide engineering services on a variety of municipal water treatment and supply and wastewater treatment and recycled use projects that include technical evaluations in support of water supply planning and master plans, surface water and groundwater characterization studies, hydrology, hydraulics, water treatment planning and design, wastewater treatment and recycled use planning, permitting, and design. Representative client sectors include State, Municipal, Special Districts, and Commercial/Industrial clients. Experience with State and Federal Safe Drinking Water Act and Clean Water Act requirements required.

Key Responsibilities

• Responsible for preparation of engineering analyses, studies, and detailed engineering plans and specifications.

• Lead and/or support in business development and capture of new clients, contracts, and business opportunities.

• Develop and participate in the presentation of proposed engineering solutions.

• Direct the compilation and presentation of results of engineering studies.

• Utilize high-level modeling systems and applications to develop engineering solutions.

• Prepare interim and completion project reports.

• Convey results and findings by means of oral discussions and presentations, and project documentation to

client.

• Responsible for the effective management of own time and effort as well as junior and mid-level technical

staff, in accordance with project budget, priorities and objectives.

• Mange scope, schedule and budget so that project milestones are accomplished within budget.

• Provide work direction and supervision to junior and mid-level technical staff and CAD operators/designer.

Desired Skills and Experience

• Minimum of a Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering from an accredited four year college or university, Masters-level education and/or Masters degree in Civil/Environmental Engineering strongly desired.

• Licensed Professional Engineer in the State of California, or the ability to obtain reciprocity within 6 months.

• Minimum 10 years of experience in water and/or wastewater engineering.

• Excellent oral and written communications.

• Demonstrated technical competence in water supply and/or wastewater characterization, treatment

process engineering, drinking water or effluent discharge/recycling regulatory requirements.

• Experience working with or managing multi-disciplinary teams on water and/or wastewater projects.

If you believe you have the necessary knowledge, experience and enthusiasm to succeed in this position, then we would like to hear from you.

Description

YOU Are you built for this opportunity? We are looking for calculated risk takers who want to be part of this kind of environment. We need people who can quickly change direction and make wise decisions, but are not afraid to jump in. We want people who bring experience and want an experience.

Our Project Engineer is primarily responsible for the following:
Assist the Project Manager in scheduling, expediting material deliveries, and all inventory management
Assist the Project Manager and Superintendent with all project related functions including preparation of purchase orders, scopes of work and contracts

Assist the Project Manager and Superintendent in conducting all meetings

Perform all the above and all other duties as assigned in accordance with applicable laws and company policies

Bachelor’s in Construction Technology preferred, Associates in Construction Technology required
Minimum 1-3 years’ construction experience
Must possess the ability to read and understand blueprints and project specifications and work with hand tools when necessary

:

We are seeking a driven R&D Electrical Engineer to join our diverse and growing engineering teams. Are you a sharp engineer who can handle a wide variety of roles and responsibilities in a collaborative work environment? Do you have a special interest in defense and national security? Are you energized by the thought of contributing towards multiple programs in a National R&D Laboratory? In this exciting and dynamic role, you may be performing a number of engineering functions, from crafting design concepts, to developing/testing actual prototypes, to guiding technology maturation efforts, and qualifying innovative fabrication and assembly techniques. You will be supporting engineering efforts across all phases of projects spanning from conceptual-design studies to full scale engineering. Along with fellow engineers, you will be engaging and collaborating regularly with personnel across multiple Sandia organizations, as well as Lawrence Livermore National Laboratories, Los Alamos National Laboratories, the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA), production agencies throughout the NNSA nuclear security enterprise, and Department of Defense organizations.

After applying, you may be interviewed and/or hired by one of the several engineering focused departments at Sandia/CA, such as Telemetry Engineering and Weapon Subsystems groups.

On any given day, depending on your specialization and interests, your responsibilities may include a few or all of the following tasks:
Design of electronic Printed Wiring Boards and Printed Wiring Assemblies (PWA) including analog and digital circuit design and FPGA firmware development and implementation
Lab testing of electrical components, devices, subsystems and systems
Developing the architecture of higher level electronic subsystems and systems; integrations and testing of multiple PWAs into a subassembly
Preparing and implementing test planning, test execution, requirements derivation
Conducting environmental testing, qualification of development and production hardware
Participating in integration activities with other engineers and product realization teams
Providing technical consultancy on critical design elements
Presenting at technical design reviews
Representing Sandia on multi-organizational project teams
Required:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or in a related discipline plus 5 years of related experience or Masters degree in Electrical Engineering or in a related discipline plus 1-year related experience, or equivalent: engineering or scientific experience and/or achievements that demonstrate the knowledge, skills, and ability to perform independent research and development.
Demonstrated experience in design and test to include one or more of the following: analog and/or digital circuit design, RF system design, embedded system design, and electromagnetic radiation (EMR) effects on electronics.
Demonstrated ability to work well in a team environment and collaborate with internal organizations and external production facilities and suppliers.
Ability to travel up to 25%.
Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. DOE Q-level security clearance.
Desired:
Experience working on engineering design, qualification, production, or related modeling/simulation projects
Familiarity with development of specifications for components
Tools/Programs: C/C\+\+, SPICE, LTSpice, MATLAB, LabVIEW, ModelSim, HDL, EAGLEPCB, Mentor Graphics, Oscilloscopes, Spectrum analyzers
Top-notch verbal and written skills, including the ability to develop and present briefings that are clear and compelling
Ability to thrive in a high-energy, collaborative, team focused environment
Experience working with DOE, NNSA, DOD or Federally Funded Research and Development Centers
Currently holding an active security clearance; DOE Q or DOD TS
Department Description:

The various Components & Systems Engineering Departments are part of the Sandia/California Weapon Engineering Centers which are responsible for assuring the safety, reliability and security of U.S. nuclear weapons enabling the defense of our nation through our nuclear strategic deterrent. The departments are comprised of groups of dedicated and motivated engineers with advanced technical degrees, primarily in mechanical and electrical engineering.

About Sandia:

Sandia National Laboratories is the nations premier science and engineering lab for national security and technology innovation, with teams of specialists focused on cutting-edge work in a broad array of areas. Some of the main reasons we love our jobs:
Challenging work withamazingimpact that contributes to security, peace, and freedom worldwide
Extraordinary co-workers
Some of the best tools, equipment, and research facilities in the world
Career advancement and enrichment opportunities
Flexible schedules, generous vacations,strongmedical and other benefits, competitive 401k, learning opportunities, relocation assistance and amenities aimed at creating a solid work/life balance\
World-changing technologies. Life-changing careers._ Learn more about Sandia at: http://www.sandia.gov

*These benefits vary by job classification.

Security Clearance:

Sandia is required by DOE to conduct a pre-employment drug test and background review that includes checks of personal references, credit, law enforcement records, and employment/education verifications. Applicants for employment need to be able to obtain and maintain a DOE Q-level security clearance, which requires U.S. citizenship. If you hold more than one citizenship (i.e., of the U.S. and another country), your ability to obtain a security clearance may be impacted.

Applicants offered employment with Sandia are subject to a federal background investigation to meet the requirements for access to classified information or matter if the duties of the position require a DOE security clearance. Substance abuse or illegal drug use, falsification of information, criminal activity, serious misconduct or other indicators of untrustworthiness can cause a clearance to be denied or terminated by DOE, resulting in the inability to perform the duties assigned and subsequent termination of employment.

EEO Statement:

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status and any other protected class under state or federal law.

British American Tobacco
Reynolds American Incorporated is positively transforming the tobacco industry. We’re a family of companies that strives for success in everything we do. ABOUT OUR ORGANIZATION:

Reynolds Tobacco Company; Santa Fe Natural Tobacco Company, Inc.; American Snuff Company, LLC; Niconovum USA, Inc.; Niconovum AB; R. J. Reynolds Vapor Company; Lorillard Licensing Company, LLC; and Reynolds Brands, Inc.. This position is with R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company (2004).

Here, you’ll have the opportunity to work on iconic brands and revolutionary products by collaborating with visionary, principled and passionate people every day.
Position Description:

This position will work on the development of vapor products, also known as e-cigarettes. Vapor products are electro-mechanical consumer devices that produce vapor from e-liquids. Design of vapor products require integrated systems engineering from a team of multiple engineering disciplines (electrical, mechanical, software, chemical, and materials engineering). Product Development Engineers work with a team in the understanding of current products and development of future products. RAI is a leader in this category of products.

Vapor products are regulated by the FDA since August 2016. This position will work with RAI’s Scientific and Regulatory Affairs group to develop necessary documentation and reporting required by regulation.

This position will report through Vapor Product Development management and will work with others on the team to drive continuous improvement in current products and in designing and developing new products.

Accountabilities/Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Responsible for technical assignments that further develop engineering skills.
Independently evaluate, select, and apply standard engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria using good judgment in making minor adaptations and modifications.
Refine Marketing and R&D concepts and utilize innovative engineering techniques to develop product solutions that will translate these concepts into commercial manufacturing reality.
Lead product development activities including concept development, feasibility analysis, scope definition, cost estimating, specification and drawing development, prototype evaluation, product risk/hazard review, vendor evaluation, resource allocation, development of manufacturing options, transition and commercialization testing, and implementation.
Lead assignments that have clear and specified objectives and require the investigation of a limited number of variables. Assistance will be provided on unusual problems from senior technical staff and work will be reviewed for application of sound professional judgment.
May lead or coordinate the work of others.
Identify and develop expertise in new technologies that can be utilized internally for development of innovative new products to the marketplace.
Identify and partner with external suppliers, vendors, and engineering service providers to develop new product solutions.
Provide technical product support during the start-up and qualification of new equipment, processes, vendors, and suppliers.
Drive continuous process improvement through the ability to recognize unnecessary complexities and process gaps, and proactively drive implementation of strategies to execute effective solutions.

Education: Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering from an Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) school in Electrical engineering or equivalent experience.

Required Skills:
Electrical circuit and component design, analysis, and evaluation
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications and ability to learn application specific software for Product Data Management (PDM)
Excellent project management, time management, team collaboration, and organizational skills
Ability to engage with stakeholders and external partners
Ability to actively participate in a Team-based environment and collaboratively work in cross functional teams
Ability to quickly develop credibility and begin influencing within an organization
Ability to work and thrive in an environment of uncertainty, ability to quickly adapt to change
Excellent people and communication skills
Ability to travel internationally
Relevant Experience and Preferred Skills:
SolidWorks or other CAD experience
Risk Management/Hazards Assessment tools, FMEA, FMECA, HACCP, Validation, or other assessment tools/methods
Quality Systems, statistical methods for data analysis
Prior consumer product development or manufacturing experience
Work in a FDA regulated environment (food, drug, medical device, tobacco)
Relevant experience may include;
Lithium-in batteries
Design f injected molded plastic parts

The Ideal Candidate will possess:

Ability to develop and drive key strategies
