About the Role: We are looking for a dynamic Facility Engineer professional to join our Enterprise Facility Services team in Flagstaff or Phoenix, Arizona. In this role, you will be part of a team that manages the building and major building infrastructure for nearly twenty manufacturing and office buildings in this region. You will work with other Facility Engineers, our Operations and Maintenance (O&M) Team, Facility Project Managers, and manufacturing equipment integration teams to manage and improve plant infrastructures which support our workplaces and manufacturing processes noted for products that are the highest quality in their class.

Responsibilities:
Interacting with the operations teams, design engineers, and other support teams in order to determine their service needs, both current and future
Directly supporting and coaching of Operations & Maintenance Team to support, troubleshoot, and continuously improve all major facility assets driving root cause understanding of system issues, ensuring assets are in our Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS), are labeled accordingly in the field, and have appropriate PM schedules (HVAC systems, air compressors, boilers, piping systems, water systems, chillers, cooling towers, building envelope, etc.)
Partnering with Enterprise Facility Services (EFS) project managers to provide technical review for the construction process; This includes specifying consistent solutions, ensuring operational needs are met, and supporting commissioning and validation within a quality system
Providing technical support for the interpretation and response to facilities related regulatory requirements in partnership with Environmental Health & Safety (EH&S) and the EFS Regulatory and Compliance COE
Developing and supporting an asset life cycle management program for facility assets, driving proactive capital and large expense projects to proactively replace and upgrade facility equipment/infrastructure and informs a 5-10 year capital plan
Developing and maintaining building and building system documentation as a tool to understand the operation and capacities of our plant systems using tools such as process and instrumentation diagrams (P&ID), single line diagrams, capacity and load spreadsheets, functional specifications, installation and operational qualification (IQ/OQ), commissioning documentation, etc
Developing sequence of operations for building operation of facility systems and working to ensure systems are operating as expected
Driving operational efficiency improvements for facility systems and appropriate alarming/indication when they are not within the building automation system (BAS)
Driving consistency in facility systems across a region with a focus on commonality to drive understanding of these systems within the team, minimizing implementation time for new or upgraded systems, and to minimize critical spares
Using of the quality system to facilitate execution and implementation of new equipment or changes to existing equipment and systems
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering Technology or equivalent field
Minimum 5 years' experience in an environment meeting the responsibilities listed above or equivalent work experience with facility mechanical systems
Practical experience developing 2D CAD documentation (models and drawings) using AutoCAD, or equivalent design software
Knowledge of related engineering disciplines, such as electrical engineering
Good documentation skills, including ability and willingness to adapt to established documentation requirements and expectations while providing input toward or driving positive improvement
Willing to support manufacturing plants that operate on a 24/7 schedule
Desire to work hands-on in critical situations in a plant facilities environment
Ability to research and use mechanical engineering concepts and facilities experience to maintain and improve our plant systems
Ability to interpret and follow applicable local and national codes
Ability to climb vertical ladders and comfortable working at heights and outdoors year round
Desired Qualifications:
Experience in commissioning of building systems and retro-commissioning of existing systems including integration into BAS Systems
Direct experience with asset life cycle management including use of a CMMS System and capital planning
Willingness to pursue and obtain CPE certification or PE License

About NECI

NECI, an Emerson Impact Partner, is the leading Digital Automation solutions provider transforming manufacturing, lab operations, process development and process control across a range of process industries in New England. NECI relentlessly seeks to drive the outcomes that change the game for our clients and is seeking team members to join in our mission.

The Role

We are currently looking for an I&C Engineer capable of supporting a wide range of work scopes focusing on instrumentation & electrical design across various DCS & PLC platforms. The I&C Engineer will work closely with NECI customers and have some working knowledge of the design and specification of Emerson products and computer networking equipment.

How Youll Be Successful
Capable of troubleshooting traditional analog and discrete signals as well as other communication types (HART, Fieldbus, Profibus, DeviceNet, AS-I, Ethernet I/P, Modbus).
Capable of utilizing various handheld testing devices to support control loop testing and/or troubleshooting of wiring and connectivity issues.
Ability to perform as part of a team.
Ability to manage multiple tasks while maintaining project commitments.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with multiple and changing priorities while maintaining strong attention to detail and a high level of accuracy.
Ability to interpret P&IDs, electrical schematics, loop drawings and general equipment arrangement drawings.
Solid written, organization and communication skills.
What Youll Do
Technical I&C site lead with ownership of customer site relationships (satisfaction, on time delivery, service and quality).
Support specification of instrumentation, control system equipment and misc. materials based on defined customer needs for assigned
projects and proposals.
Manage and provide direction to site vendors to maintain project schedule.
Create and review OEM/vendor submittals for adherence to customer standards and defined controls guidelines.
Execute pre-FAT/FAT on OEM or customer supplied equipment.
Execute site startup activities (loop checks/commissioning).
Generate and manage loop check/commissioning documentation.
Generate and manage project punch lists to completion.
Utilize DCS/PLC platform software to support troubleshooting (e.g. DeltaV Diagnostics, AMS Device Manager)
Support I&C engineering (FEED) studies based on customer requests.
Work with sales team to lead proposal efforts by assisting with I&C estimates, site walkdowns, scope write-ups and preliminary BOM
generation.
Provide feedback to the organization of site opportunities.
Physical demands: Lifting to 50 lbs.
Travel: 90% travel within the MA, RI and CT.
What Youll Bring
Bachelors Degree in related engineering field or equivalent.
Minimum of 3 years experience in engineering or related field.
Knowledge of the basic concepts of process control theory.
Understanding of DCS/PLC physical layer and control hardware (DeltaV specific preferred)
Knowledge of Microsoft Products. (Excel, Word, Access, Project)
DCS/PLC programming preferred
Some understanding of DeltaV software physical layer configuration
Experience working with cGMP or in a validated environment
Understanding of hazardous area and intrinsic safety design
Working knowledge of AutoCAD software
Heres What Youll Get
Highly competitive Medical and Dental Insurance
Flexible Spending Accounts for medical expenses and dependent care expenses
4-6 weeks Paid Time Off
401(k)
Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)
Employee Referral Bonus
Professional Development Reimbursement
NECI paid Basic Life & Short-Term, Long-Term Disability Insurance
Voluntary Benefits - Accident, Term Life, Whole Life Insurance
Flu Shot Clinic & First Aid/AED/CPR Classes
Must be currently authorized to work in the United States.

Job Description:
We are AAM. We have the POWER to move the world.

At AAM, we're looking for associates who push boundaries and drive solutions for the future. Innovators. Thinkers. Dreamers. Doers. No matter the role or function, every associate is a piece of what makes AAM great. Were growing and building #TeamAAM to be the best. Join us!

Job Posting Title

Senior IT Systems Engineer - Office 365 / Exchange

Job Description Summary

Provides day to day support of O365 application suite following ITIL standards. Performing Third-level support for questions and problems relating to Office 365 applications, related device hardware and software and computer networks. Interfacing with vendors in addressing complex problems and technical issues. Execute project in IT Collaboration Services function that supports O365 technologies, Exchange, Azure AD, SP Online, Skype / Teams, OneDrive, Conditional Access, Intune and Teams.

Manage Office 365 tenant
Understand Microsoft changes to Office 365 applications
Preform updates and fixes to current setting within O365
Demonstrate strong team leadership skills with a focus on results
Support and administration of Microsoft Unified Communications solutions including Lync/Skype for Business and Exchange
Manage Office 365 licensing, ensuring the appropriate license level for cost-efficiencies
Superior work ethic, with flexible and client aware demeanor
Exceptional documentation, presentation, and communication skills
Broad knowledge of Microsoft technologies and products, with specialization in one or more of the following: PowerShell, Office365, Exchange Online, Windows Server / Microsoft Deployments
Office 365 eDiscovery, Legal Holds, mailbox exports
PowerShell scripting for managing AD attributes, and O365 services
Administration of Microsoft ATP for Exchange anti-spam
Experience in Active Directory, DNS Group management, shared mailbox and resource mailbox management
Support for SMTP services (central enterprise relay)
Provide recommendations on changes and design enhancements to improve reliability, security, processes, and performance.
Take responsibility for meeting commitments; desire to succeed and has a history of meeting solutions by deadline.
Build respectful relationships with team members; consistently acknowledges and appreciates each member's contributions.
Provides quality customer service above else
3rd tier support for users; knowledge of mail clients on all Operating systems (desktop and mobile).
3+ years of experience with Microsoft Cloud Solutions design and operations
3+ years of Office 365 (Exchange Online, Skype for Business, Teams, Intune, CA, etc.)
Experience working with users in large, geographically dispersed environments
Office365 license and feature management
Familiarity with Cloud Access Security Broker technology
PowerShell scripting within O365/Azure/Teams/SharePoint required
Work with internal change management for end user training/communication

Bachelors Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field required
Industry certifications and memberships a plus
Excellent IT, communication, leadership and management skills
Knowledgeable of managing Office 365 tenant
Minimum 7 years of experience in IT and 5 years in Office 365 and exchange
About American Axle & Manufacturing

For over 20 years, customers around the world have entrusted AAM to design, engineer, validate and manufacture driveline, metal forming, powertrain, and casting technologies for automotive, commercial and industrial markets. Today, we are a premier global Tier 1 automotive supplier with broad capabilities across multiple product lines to deliver efficient, powerful and innovative solutions for our customers. Weve earned the trust of our suppliers and our customers through our steadfast commitments to quality, operational excellence and technology leadership.

AAM delivers power. We deliver power literally through vehicle components, systems and innovation, but we also deliver power in ways unseen. We power our associates, their families, and the communities in which we operate. Our global team of over 25,000 associates has a clear vision of where AAM is going and how we are going to get there. After all, they are the reason we are a leader in the automotive industry. We are powering the future. We are AAM. Move with us, and join #TeamAAM.

Description
Simply Put, A Great Place to Work


Alfred Benesch & Company (Benesch) is a growing, multi-disciplined engineering and professional services firm. Water\wastewater treatment plants, municipal facilities, schools, parks, and airports are just a few examples of where you can find our work. We enhance infrastructure and communities across the country – creating spaces and providing connections in ways that make a difference.

As a mid-sized firm, we pride ourselves on being nimble enough to remain responsive to client needs, yet large enough to offer exceptional bench strength. As a member of our team, you’ll have an opportunity to draw from those resources when you need them, and likewise, contribute your expertise when you have something to share. Opportunity abounds here for those that seek it.

Our comprehensive benefits package includes paid over-time, exceptional retirement fund contributions, flexible schedules, wellness incentives and all-around great people to work with. Take your career to the next level by applying today. You’ll like it here. It’s a great place to work.

Electrical Project Engineer – Detroit, MI


The ideal candidate will have experience in the design, construction, and start-up of power, control and process instrumentation systems for water, wastewater, and stormwater pump stations, industrial campuses and facilities including implementation of computer control and data collection at primary and remote facilities. Electrical power experience to include the power distribution and protection of switchgear, motors/motor control centers, electrical panels, surge protection, transformers, medium voltage looped systems, and low voltage systems for municipal, commercial and industrial facilities. Also, experience in short circuit, protective coordination and arc flash studies using Paladin DesignBase software is a plus.

You Will Be Responsible For:
Ensuring completeness of the electrical design and deployment/delivery details
Managing the process of compiling and coordinating plans, cost estimates, and pay items
Developing and reviewing cost estimates as well as monitoring and comparing to client expectations
Coordinating and/or reviewing drafting and assembly of plan set
Overseeing layout and/or reviewing drawings for a project
Assembling competent project communications, including meeting minutes, technical documents and complete reports that require little editing and meet the client expectations
Assuming responsibility for project design calculation files and assuring adequate independent quality control reviews on that work
Checking and signing off on electrical design calculations and plan elements prior to Quality Assurance
Assuming responsibility and ownership of the assigned project components
Developing project electrical design criteria for the assigned project components
Assuring compliance with project CADD standards
Understanding and monitoring the overall required scope and schedule for the project deliverables.
Identifying deficiencies and proposing corrective action
Fostering the team environment and promoting team communication while assisting in identifying and addressing team conflicts
What You Will Need:


Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering or other related discipline required
Minimum 10 years of experience in providing design and construction support of multiple electrical projects for municipal, state, federal and private clients required
Current Professional Engineer’s licensure with the ability to obtain licensure in multiple states
Demonstrated ability/experience with the following software: Bentley MicroStation/Projectwise, AutoCAD, AGi32, Generator sizing software, Power systems analysis software (SKM PowerTools, Paladin DesignBase, etc.)
Excellent communication and client relation skills

Job Title: Electrical Engineer - Motor Control and Hardware
Job Description:
We are looking for an Electrical Engineer who is passionate about solving complex problems while developing awesome battery operated kids’ products. We create product concepts, validate them through rigorous prototyping, and we scrutinize the design and manufacturing details to develop outstanding products. Experience developing electro-mechanical consumer products that found success in the marketplace is a requirement. We are looking for a creative engineer who can bring ideas, solve electro-mechanical challenges, and drive the product into production on schedule, at cost target and with great quality.

Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering
At least 4+ years of engineering electronic consumer products
Demonstrated ability to design and develop electro-mechanical products from concept to production
Responsible for specifying electronic components, electronic hardware and software design, PCB design, firmware programming, defining bill of materials, component cost & project timelines
Solid background in power engineering and controls, including knowledge of motor control and basic sensor principles.
Experience with project management and working with overseas team/vendors
Collaborating with industrial designers and mechanical engineers is key to success
About Us:

To be the World's Most Loved Children's Brand, we need the best people to join our team! Radio Flyer holds a special place in people's hearts. This is true because Radio Flyer transports people to a happy time, to the best parts of childhood, a time when anything was possible. For over 100 years, our company has produced innovative toys that inspire active play, bring smiles and create warm memories that last a lifetime. Beyond our classic Little Red Wagon, Radio Flyer invents and designs some of the most recognizable tricycles, ride-ons, scooters and battery operated vehicles in the industry.

Radio Flyer has consistently been recognized as a top workplace and received numerous awards such as, Fortune’s Best Small & Medium Workplaces, Wall Street Journal’s Top Small Workplaces, the Daily Herald’s Best Places to Work in Illinois, Crain’s Best Places to Work, Entrepreneur and CultureIQ’s Top Company Culture. Radio Flyer is a recognized leader in the toy industry, awarded Toy of the Year, Crain’s most Patents per Capita, and three time award winner of the Chicago Innovation Award. Our global headquarters is in Chicago and we are led by Robert Pasin, grandson of the company founder.

We’re idealists and inventors. Forever tinkering with products and processes, always on the lookout for improvements. A job at Radio Flyer will be demanding. But it also rewards bright, original thinking and hard work. And none of us here would have it any other way.

Above all, the individual must commit to our values:

FUN-omenal Customer Experiences

Live with Integrity

Yes I Can

Excellence in Everything

Responsible for Success

We are looking for people who live our values and support our vision and mission!

At Radio Flyer, we appreciate different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives —encouraging everyone to bring their authentic selves to work. We are committed to employing a diverse workforce and are a proud equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

Required Skills

Required Experience

Job Location
Chicago, US-IL

Lead efforts to maximize PIC test quality and efficiency. Work with cross-functional teams to improve the bring-up of new test capability, qualify test stations for manufacturing, and drive continuous improvement in test capability and efficiency to meet requirements for PIC Development and Manufacturing.

Education & Experience Necessary For Success:

MS required and MS with 3+ year work experiences (preferred); Major in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, or Applied Physics
Hands-on experience with fundamental and advanced characterization techniques for photonic devices or electronic devices
Experience with optoelectronic test equipment including tunable lasers, wavemeters, tunable filters, switches, and programmable power supplies
Exposure to opto-electronic fundamentals, including waveguide modes, semiconductor lasers, photo detectors, and so on
Strong ability of successfully executing experiments in a lab environment.
Ability to work with other teams and groups is essential

Leadership skills or ability of developing leadership in manufacturing test sustaining is preferred

WHO WE ARE
Come join the Metropolitan Council as a Systems Engineer 3. We are seeking to fill one (1) vacancyin our Information Services Department.

We are the Metropolitan Council, the regional government for the seven-county Twin Cities metropolitan area. We plan 30 years ahead for the future of the metropolitan area and provide regional transportation, wastewater, and housing services. More information about us on our website.

We are committed to supporting a diverse workforce that reflects the communities we serve.

The Information Services department has 100+ staff members and is a full-service, customer support driven technology team. This position joins a team of systems engineers who are accountable for 6 on-premise data centers and the associated equipment that includes but is not limited to; servers; Microsoft and Linux, Virtualized server environments; VMWare and HyperV, Storage-3 tiers storage, backup and recovery, O365 (hosted on AZURE).
The Systems Engineer 3 is a senior level position responsible for all aspects of enterprise systems including designing, planning, testing, implementation and support. This includes support of assigned assets typically located in one of our data centers. The Systems Engineer 3
will work as part of a team, designing, building, integrating and supporting the Enterprise's computing environment.

Note: May require travel between primary worksite and various locations on short notice to resolve computer system problems.

This job will be open continuous until filled and may close at any time after 03/20/20 at 11:59PM.
Priority review will be given to those that apply by Friday, March 20th, 2020.

What you would do in this job
Administer hardware and software functions that include design/configuration, implementation, systems monitoring and tuning of data center specific equipment
Documents all designs and configurations of systems to be deployed
Manages and controls enterprise mission critical systems which support all Council functions and ensures that all systems are functional and reliable
Identifies and resolves system- level incidents and problems
Provides basic project management skills for internal IS projects, participates on project teams for larger initiatives and may take on the role of project lead depending on the technology
May be placed in a customer liaison role for day-to-day support activities and/or to resolve critical computing functions
Writes business correspondence for recommendations, project support, and customer service purposes and acts as a technical subject matter expert as needed
Installs and configures systems at a variety of physical locations including configuration, testing and debugging to ensure system integrity
Provides systems performance reporting regularly along with ensuring all software is at current version levels and maintaining a log of changes for tracking
Provides support to other areas of IS and customers as necessary for problem definition, resolution and ensures the effective use of systems being supported.
Researches, evaluates and recommends new hardware and software products related to the Council's needs
Provides documentation to support recommendations including; options, benefits of implementation, time required, necessary hardware/software and cost estimate
Acts as a consultant to business partners and a mentor to more junior staff
Performs other related duties and responsibilities as required
What education and experience are required for this job (minimum qualifications)

A Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field AND five (5) years' experience in the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of corporate phone systems, related software, and voice networks.
OR
An Associate's degree/Certificate in Computer Science or related field AND seven (7) years' experience in the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of corporate phone systems, related software, and voice networks.
OR
H.S. Diploma or equivalent AND nine (9) years' experience in the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of corporate phone systems, related software, and voice networks.

What additional skills and experience would be helpful in this job (desired qualifications):
Additional years of experience beyond qualifications listed above
Extensive experience working with Microsoft Windows 2016, Virtualization technology (HyperV, VMWare), SAN or detached storage, backup, and recovery processes
Experience with developing detailed design, implementation and support documents
Experience with monitoring and reporting
Previous experience in a CJIS environment in support of Law Enforcement systems is a plus
Experience utilizing tools such as PowerBuilder to develop automated process for repetitive tasks
Advanced Active Directory knowledge
Experience in mentoring junior software engineers
Experience in PowerShell
Experience in documentation and process management
Complex problem solving abilities
What knowledge, skills and abilities you should have within the first six months on the job:
Advanced skills with managing and configuring virtualized hosts for HyperV and/or VMWare
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Server version 2016
Advanced knowledge of detached storage solutions
Strong understanding of overall information security best practices
Ability to provide superior and quality customer service
Problem solving across multiple domains and servers
Ability to prioritize and balance multiple tasks
Ability to communicate effectively with peers, business units and vendors
Ability to implement corrective systems actions
Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision
What you can expect from us:
We offer the opportunity to make a difference and positively influence the Twin Cities metropolitan area.
We encourage our employees to develop their skills through on-site training and tuition reimbursement.
We provide a competitive salary, excellent benefits and a good work/life balance.
More about why you should join us!

Additional information

Union/Grade: Non Represented, Grade I
FLSA Status: Exempt
Full Salary Range: $38.31-$57.83 Hourly/$79,685-$120,286 annually

What your work environment would be:
You would perform your work in a standard office setting. Work may sometimes require travel between your primary work site and other sites.

What steps the recruitment process involves:
We review your minimum qualifications.
We rate your education and experience.
We conduct a structured panel interview.
Once you have successfully completed the steps above, then:

If you are new to the Metropolitan Council, you must pass a background check, which verifies education and employment, covers driving record (if applicable to the job) and any criminal record. If you have a criminal conviction, you do not automatically fail. The Metropolitan Council considers felony, gross misdemeanor and misdemeanor convictions on a case-by-case basis, based on whether they are related to the job and whether the candidate has demonstrated adequate rehabilitation.

If you are already an employee of the Metropolitan Council, you must pass a criminal background check if the job you're applying for is safety sensitive, is a supervisory or management job, is in the Finance, Information Services or Human Resources departments, or has access to financial records, files/databases, cash, vouchers or transit fare cards.

IMPORTANT: If you make a false statement or withhold information, you may be barred from job consideration.

The Metropolitan Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities. If you have a disability that requires accommodation during the selection process, please call Human Resources at 651.602.1398.

About the Position:

Lewis is seeking a talented Project Engineer eager to join exciting projects of varying complexity and size throughout the Portland Metro Area. At Lewis, we aim to be a company that provides fulfilling careers, and this position is no different. Project Engineers are essential to the success of our projects, and they bring creativity, problem-solving, and a passion for building to our sites.

Alongside the Project Manager, you’ll assist with the planning and daily execution of the construction project including subcontractor management, cost management, and quality control. You’ll take the lead on maintaining other aspects of the project as assigned, including managing the process of submittal approvals, coordinating the timely delivery of materials, and overseeing schedules and budgets.

About You:

When it comes to construction, you have a unique passion for building and are eager to make an impact on the growing Portland area. On all projects, you take pride in getting it right – exceeding client expectations is at the top of your list and you gain satisfaction knowing you’ve completed a job well done. You’re considered an expert in your responsibilities from project start to project finish and teams can rely utilizing your natural talents for problem solving, attention to detail and quick thinking.

If you are looking for a role that provides leadership and development opportunities and the tasks outlined below sound fulfilling to you, this position is the right fit.

PRIMARY FUNCTIONS AND ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Project Engineering and Document Control
Working knowledge of project estimating as it relates to assigned areas of responsibility
Working knowledge of project schedule and assist in maintaining the project computerized schedule
Work with Lead Project Engineer and Project Manager to prepare scope of work instructions, technical requirements and bid packages for subcontractor and vendor items
Utilize the project management system to expedite, review and approve shop drawings, submittals and safety requirements for assigned tasks
Distribute approved submittals to pertinent subcontractors
Ensure that assigned materials and equipment are released for fabrication in adequate lead time to accommodate the required jobsite delivery date, designated by the Superintendent on assigned tasks; procure other materials and equipment as instructed by the Lead Project Engineer and Project Superintendent
Obtain and check subcontractor pricing and assist in assembling change quotations as directed by the Lead Project Engineer or Project Manager
Assist in maintaining the project files, close-out and storage of documents at completion
Working knowledge of the contract documents to include reviewing all drawings and specifications for design inconsistencies and conflicts
Know and understand the subcontract documents as they apply to assigned areas of responsibility
Write field questions and expedite answers from Architect to allow the assigned components of the work to be fabricated and installed in the most efficient manner
Assist in documenting changes, maintain project record drawings and specifications
Foster and encourage a diverse and inclusive workplace
Customer Relations and Communication
Build effective relationships with customers, design team, subcontractors, suppliers and user groups that reflect company core values; and meet and exceed the customer’s expectations.
Clear communication skills and a collaborative approach are essential for a Project Engineer, enabling them to share information between relevant teams and trades
Exhibit superior writing skills; review and correspond with subcontractors and vendors for assigned tasks
Receive and distribute information on clarifications and changes in the work for areas of responsibility
Prepare and distribute meeting minutes as directed by the Lead Project Engineer or Project Manager
IN ORDER TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE
Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Engineering or related field or equivalent years of experience required
3+ years of general contracting experience, preferably with proven performance on large commercial building projects
Proficiency in programs such as Navisworks and Bluebeam will be essential to succeed in this role
Prior experience with MEP systems coordination and complex structure is preferred
Creative problem solving and excellent communication skills
ABOUT US

At Lewis where every employee is an owner, our people are empowered to make decisions—big and small—to meet the goals of our clients. Our promise: “Every Decision. Every Detail. Every Day.” means we are passionate about getting it right, day in and day out, and driven to deliver cool projects and build quality buildings that stand the test of time. With fulfillment as one of our six core values, Lewis has a collaborative and supportive culture committed to the success and development of our people.

Lease Crutcher Lewis offers competitive compensation and benefits.

Driving innovation since 1996.
PCH is a global company headquartered in Ireland with operations in Shenzhen, China and San Francisco.
When PCH was founded 22 years ago we quickly began making waves in China's product development and manufacturing industry as an agile partner helping companies produce at scale premier products more efficiently while keeping quality at the forefront. In 2012, those waves reached the shores of the California Pacific Coast when we opened our 35,000 square foot PCH Innovation Hub in San Francisco's Potrero Hill neighborhood. Our hub brings us closer to Silicon Valley, where we have been supporting many of the region's most recognized global brands and world-class Industrial Design studios for decades.
With an impressive customer roster, we are growing our team. We are looking to recruit talented, passionate and driven individuals to our exceptional team in San Francisco. Our Innovation Hub is home to our product design engineering and development team, including mechanical, electrical and firmware engineers, program managers and operational staff. Partnering with our manufacturing and supply chain colleagues in Shenzhen, we work together to guide products from concept to the consumer out-of-box experience.
Who are we?
The PCH team is creative, collaborative and out of the ordinary. We take pride in our work and we have a lot of fun along the way! As an employer, we offer:
- An exceptional team environment where we are passionate about our work and value our colleagues
- A commitment to your personal and professional growth
- A healthy work-life balance in a positive, open and inclusive work environment
- Competitive compensation, comprehensive life benefits, and parental leave options
- The opportunity to travel for project exchanges, collaborations and transitions
- Monthly barbecues, regular after-work outings, and engaging in-house activities to foster relationships across disciplines and departments
- Weekly lunches and a well-stocked kitchen to fuel your creative energy
- An in-house state-of-the-art prototyping lab
Does this sound like the place for you? Please read through the job description carefully and submit all requested application materials. We have openings at various levels of expertise and invite you to apply to the posting that most closely matches your experience level. We are thrilled to be growing our team and can't wait to meet you!

The Opportunity

Are you capable of designing electrical solutions to complex engineering challenges? Can you work with intensity and friendliness alongside designers from a broad range of disciplines? Are you looking for a position that will challenge and grow your current skill-set every day?

As a Senior Electrical Engineer, you are responsible for leading electrical engineering product development from concept through test to mass production of a high-volume consumer product. Our ideal candidate has a well-rounded background in all aspects of electrical design including an in-depth knowledge of systems architecture, low-level software, board layout and design, power management, and RF design. We are not only looking for a candidate that excels in skill, but also someone excited to be a productive and integral member of our close-knit team.
As a Senior EE at PCH, you will:
Experience the life cycle of designing a product at a fast-paced consultancy
Partner closely with the mechanical design and program management teams to ensure beautiful designs that also provide a seamless and intuitive user experience
Interact with third-party teams (ex: industrial design firms) to deliver designs that meet client expectations
Work both behind the scenes in the lab and, at times, be center stage with clients to present your team’s progress
Travel occasionally to China to collaborate with our manufacturing team on bringing a product successfully to market
Contribute not only to PCH’s portfolio of work, but also to our workplace culture of inclusivity, creativity, determination and fun!

As a Senior EE professional, you bring:
A BS or MS in Electrical Engineering and 6+ years of professional experience
Technical ability to act as lead on projects and support teammates in brainstorming and collaborating to solve problems quickly
Experience shipping products multiple and exposure to full hardware development cycle
In-depth knowledge of all aspects of electrical design including analog/digital circuit design, schematic capture, and debugging
Knowledge of low-power, battery operated and wireless portable devices
Circuit design experience with emphasis on mixed signal and embedded system design (including ARM-based controllers, power management, firmware/device drivers, electrical signal characterization, and interfacing environmental sensors)
Extensive experience with board bring-up, debug and validation
Proven collaborative skills to work with cross-disciplinary teams
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain high level concepts to our clients
Enthusiasm for your craft and a desire to expand your skill-set
Flexibility and positivity to every challenge
Priority technical skills include:
RF design, antenna simulation and tuning using a VNA
Audio design
Familiarity with display driver ICs
WiFi and cellular experience
Electrical motor and motor drivers
Production and performance testing

If it can be imagined, it can be made.
At PCH, we push past the normal standards of customer satisfaction, engineering and manufacturing ingenuity, and what it means to be a collaborative team.
We partner with innovative Fortune 500 companies and startups that are passionate about design, brand, and the consumer experience. We help guide product development through all phases of the product journey -- from concept and design engineering, manufacturing, pack out and fulfillment, to supply chain and inventory management. Hardware development is fast-paced and rewarding. At PCH we are proud to celebrate our successes as a team.
If you are an imaginative, thoughtful, and open-minded innovator, we'd love to meet you.

Job Title: Principal Electrical Manufacturing Engineer - Critical Care
Job Description:
The Principal Electrical Manufacturing Engineer is an exciting opportunity to collaborate on projects and initiatives in support of Edwards Lifesciences Advanced Hemodynamic monitoring systems. This position will play a key role in the development and execution of the manufacturing and operations strategy, including leading key projects and initiatives, supporting ongoing manufacturing, new product commercialization, line extensions, interfacing with third party providers, and leading product and process improvements.

The Staff Electrical Manufacturing Engineer’s responsibilities will include:
Apply knowledge of technical principles and process excellence (Lean / Six Sigma) to define, develop, maintain and optimize manufacturing and service processes for Critical Care’s Electronics Business.
Use technical principles, problem solving skills, and data analysis to support and problem-solve for production and service at local, global, and third party suppliers through a robust supplier interface.
Drive incorporation of technical advancements, product improvements, and cost reductions through manufacturing enhancements, product changes, and part qualifications.
Work and lead initiatives to support manufacturing projects and goals (material qualification, supplier changes, part changes, product changes, product enhancements, equipment qualifications) through technical advancements, problem solving skills, and process excellence methodologies.
Lead key project initiatives (supplier transfers, part changes, system enhancements, line extensions, cost reductions, labor efficiency improvements, and quality and compliance excellence).
Provide ongoing support and training to the production/service personnel on new processes, process changes, and systems to increase quality and productivity in the build, test, and servicing of electronics products.
Understand and maintain assembly, test, and servicing processes, equipment, and tools to ensure availability of tools and equipment for the operators as required for local and global sites.
Manage change control for ongoing manufacturing changes, including change requests, process changes, Device Master Record, product specifications, test processes, and product service processes.
Deploy, review, and act upon meaningful metrics to measure, control, define, refine, and optimize processes and for process control and continuous improvement.
Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Requirements/Qualification:
Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering is required with a minimum of 8 years of relevant work experience; OR Master’s Degree in Engineering with a minimum of 7 years of work experience. Prior medical device industry experience is required.
Understanding of product and process change control, design control, MRP / Inventory processes, and Quality System requirements.
Familiarity with medical device regulations and governance documents (ISO13485, CFR820, etc).
Experience writing and executing protocols for validation of tools, fixtures, equipment, and process.
Must have the ability to train, coach and mentor operators on how to use the procedures effectively.
Capable of analyzing and solving complex problems through innovative thought and experience. Capable of making decisions based on data, analysis, and problem solving methods (ex: DMAIC) then acting quickly to deploy the resulting desired option.
Demonstrated experience with process excellence and continuous improvement in the manufacturing/service environment.
Experience working with suppliers of electronics components, subassemblies, and finished devices.
Experience writing, developing, and maintaining procedures for assembly, service, and test.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to communicate clearly through presentations, written documents, and verbally.
Ability to perform root cause analysis and recommendations for non-conforming products.
Understanding of product and process change control, MRP / Inventory processes, and Quality System requirements.
Preferred:
Lean Champion and/or Six Sigma certifications preferred.
Ability to use Mechanical CAD tools (Solidworks or ProE).
Ability to read electronics schematics and mechanical drawings.
Experience troubleshooting and documenting evaluations of finished devices, sub-assemblies, and component failures.
Edwards is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer including protected Veterans and individuals with disabilities.
Competitors: Medtronic, Boston Scientific, St. Jude Medical

Job Description:
Forensic Electrical Engineer (Full Time)
Location: Parsippany, NJ

H2M Architects + Engineers, a multidiscipline architectural, engineering, environmental consulting firm with offices in NY and NJ seeks a Forensic Electrical Engineer to join our Parsippany, NJ office.

Job Responsibilities:
Performs forensic investigations, including fire origin and cause investigations, to identify the cause and origin of incidents that lead to failures, damages or defects in the electrical fields, supplies, systems, components, equipment and appliances within industrial, commercial and residential locations.
Provides electrical engineering expertise to insurance, residential, commercial and legal clients.
Analyzes fires involving various types of electrical equipment and wiring systems
Performs onsite inspections to determine cause of equipment and product defects or failure.
Documents as-built conditions and damage to residential, commercial, and industrial electrical systems and develop a scope of repair/replacement.
Communicates with clients and provides detailed findings.
Manages multiple project assignments and executes them on time and within budget.
May inspect and assess damage to electrical equipment, due to natural catastrophes, such as floods and hurricanes.
Retention and development of client relationships.
Willing to travel, as needed.
Experience/Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering from ABET accredited program.
Licensed P.E. in New Jersey or New York and possesses the ability to obtain NAFI- CFEI
5+ years Electrical Engineering experience, preferably in the forensic and fire investigation field.
Skills in analyzing, interpreting, synthesizing, prioritizing, and reporting pertinent information, discerning the essential from the non-essential, and grasping complexities of unusual or complicated cases; research and investigative abilities.
Moderate travel and/or field work (valid driver’s license and reliable vehicle required).Able to communicate effectively (written and verbal) with co-workers, clients and subcontractors.
Able to work with managers to address technically complex projects in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and respond to client needs efficiently.
Experience with insurance companies, expert testimony and consulting engineering a plus.
We offer a comprehensive benefit package including medical/dental/vision insurance with HSA & FSA, life and LTD insurance, 401(k) with matching contributions, a flexible work environment, annual bonus, tuition reimbursement, excellent professional development program AND MUCH MORE!

our staff
At H2M, our people are at the heart of everything we do, and we’re always seeking new talent to join our team. Whether you’re a college student or a seasoned professional, we offer career opportunities at every level, in areas ranging from architecture to administration.

We’re passionate about our work, dedicated to our clients, and committed to our legacy. We emphasize collaboration and community involvement and promote sustainability in our practice, ensuring that the right projects are developed with minimal impact on the environment. Our integrated approach to design incorporates the diverse voices and visions of our staff into every project. Through mentoring, peer reviews, and professional development opportunities, employees at every level are offered the opportunity to share best practices and gain new experiences.

our approach
Since our early roots, our focus has remained steadfast: to provide quality service with sound judgment and to serve as an honest professional resource to our clients. With a dedicated, responsive staff and multiple service offerings under one roof, we blend “can-do” with “can-be,” developing real, workable solutions with a dose of innovation. Our diverse in-house expertise reduces the need for sub-consultants and ensures that our architects and engineers develop a comprehensive understanding of every project.

Providing solutions to a wide variety of markets, H2M brings the combined expertise of architectural design and building systems engineering to make your project a reality. With in-house MEP and structural teams, we’re able to take a holistic approach to project design that combines a practical approach with creative results.

www.h2m.com
Competitors: AECOM, Langan Engineering and Environmental Services, WSP

MITRE is a trusted operator of federally funded research and development centers and we’re on a mission to make the world a safer place—for all of humanity, today and in the future. To deliver on our mission, we need the world’s best talent and leaders—groundbreakers and partnership-builders on a global scale in areas like healthcare, artificial intelligence, critical infrastructure resiliency, pandemic management, and cybersecurity. In return, we have the privilege of backing you with thousands of technical experts in diverse fields, a culture of innovation and knowledge sharing, access to data and resources uniquely available to MITRE through our wide-ranging partnerships across government, industry and academia.

The MITRE Corporation is seeking a smart, energetic cyber security engineer with expertise in the operation of and cyber protections for cyber physical and control systems, and security for Internet of Things (IOT). You will need to be proactive in investigating novel technical approaches, developing software prototypes and in giving technical demonstrations. You will be working in a dynamic environment, which encourages creativity and requires you to keep pace with current and emerging technologies and practices.

Key Functions:
The candidate will work in the public interest to provide technical expertise in solving our sponsor's critical software engineering problems.
The candidate will apply their knowledge of ICS/SCADA, software engineering and networking to address new cyber defense techniques.


Minimum Qualifications:
BS and 2 years related experience
Applicants selected for this position will be subject to a
government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for
access to classified information or applicants who are eligible for security
clearances.
Required Qualifications:
Possess core knowledge of computer science curricula including operating systems, software engineering, compilers and parsing, design and analysis of algorithms, etc.
Experience in an industrial controls environment (power plants/energy, manufacturing, utility, or equivalent) with working knowledge of SCADA/DCS systems and related hardware and software.
Possess knowledge of cyber security fundamentals.
The ideal candidate will have the ability to think critically, work in group settings and be proactive in pursuing research and problem-solving with minimal supervision.
Able to obtain and maintain a Secret level security clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong foundation in Computer Science or Engineering, EE or Mathematics.
Possess some experience in mobile computing as well as security for mobile computing to include knowledge of devices and underlying operating systems.
Ability to work effectively as part of a team.
Possess strong writing and communication skills.

Job Summary:
Under indirect supervision, the Lead Building Engineer oversees and coordinates the safe and efficient operation and maintenance of all building systems, specifically facility operations. Supervises and works with onsite staff in the installation, repair, and maintenance of the site infrastructure, building equipment and controls located throughout buildings. Provides exceptional customer interface and oversee all facilities related projects, contractors, vendors, systems and procedures. Conducts routine and on-going assessments of the building infrastructure, equipment and all assigned staff.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Include but are not limited to the following:
Communicates effectively and appropriately while providing exceptional customer service and support.
Monitor, adjust and utilize the building automation system to efficiently operate the HVAC equipment in order to provide a comfortable environment for the building occupants.
Perform inspections and conduct periodic general preventive maintenance on the building mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems. This involves normal lubrication, adjustments, cleaning, water treatment, and periodic testing of all equipment including but not limited to chillers, cooling towers, pumps, air handling units, boilers, VAV boxes, variable frequency drives, water heaters and air compressors.
Fill out daily equipment logs and perform visual inspections of all building mechanical and life safety equipment to ensure normal operation.
Respond to, prioritize and complete assigned work orders via the CMMS work order tracking system.
Coordinate work activities of contractors & outside vendors and assist them with isolation of building systems as necessary and monitor their workmanship.
Repair and maintenance of other building equipment including but not limited to doors, walls, ceilings, light fixtures, plumbing fixtures, roofs, locks and keys.
Respond immediately and effectively to ensure building occupant safety in all emergency situations including fire, evacuations and equipment failure.
Regular coordination and communications with Facilities Director regarding maintenance issues, work order status, budgets and special projects.
Oversee, coordinate and communicate tasks and requests with Day Porter / Janitorial Staff as necessary to maintain site excellence.
Manage and oversee the shipping/ receiving and mailroom duties.
Be available weekends and after hours for scheduled and emergency maintenance functions.
Comply with all applicable codes, regulations, and company directives as relates to building operations and practice safe work habits.
Be outgoing, predictable, courteous, neat, clean, and in proper uniform; always representing the Company in a professional, moral, and ethical manner.
All other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
Must have minimum of 5 years building operations and maintenance experience.
Must be proficient in the use of a personal computer, handheld communication device and have knowledge of CMMS software such as Infor.
Experience with HVAC systems and DDC controllers and computerized building automation systems.
Excellent communications ability, both verbal and written.
Ability to interact with co-workers, tenants, contractors, and the general public in a positive and professional manner.
Must possess a valid driver’s license.
Possess competent knowledge on the methods, tools, and equipment used in the maintenance, repair, and troubleshooting of HVAC, plumbing, and electrical equipment and systems.
Ability to read blueprints and or schematics to aid in troubleshooting analysis.
A valid HVAC or electrical license may also be required.

Become an integral part of a diverse team in the Mission, Cyber and Intelligence Solutions (MCIS) Group. Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, mission oriented Network/Systems Engineer, in the Herndon, VA area, with strong Customer relationships. At ManTech, you will help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.

The ISS Division provides cyber solutions to a wide range of Defense and Intelligence Community customers. This division consists of a team of technical leaders that deliver advanced technical solutions to government organizations. Our customers have high standards, are technically adept, and use our products daily to support their mission of protecting national security. Our contributions to our customers success is driving our growth.

Are you looking for a small cohesive team that offers flexible hours and a large amount of technical autonomy Are you always seeking out and utilizing new technologies to apply them in the production infrastructure of a unique customer set? Look no further! Our current operations are done primarily outside of the confines of a SCIF. We are dedicated to the mission but we understand the importance of a unified and fun working atmosphere. The candidate needs to enjoy technology as well as finding new innovative ways of solving current business needs and building new technical ideas and concepts.

For this position we are seeking a candidate with a strong network engineering and administration background. The candidate should either have experience in networking technologies or a desire to expand their networking knowledge and capabilities.

Responsibilities include but not limited to:
Build out new architectures as needed and maintain secure networked system best practices
Perform routine maintenance at the operating system and network level
Assist with troubleshooting and fixing system/network problems (Linux, Windows, Cisco)
Make modifications to accommodate hardware and network upgrades/refreshes
The individual is required to document activities and work within a tight knit team environment
Infrequently but as required, work any extended shifts to support the customers mission
A willingness to further knowledge by continuing education or formal training
Have a passion for technology and process improvement
General knowledge of a wide range of cyber and other technical fields
Experience/Skills (Required):
System Administration/Engineering (preferably Linux and Windows)
Experience with virtualization technologies such as ESX, Linux KVM
A high degree of familiarly with Layer 2 and 3 network engineering and troubleshooting
VPN technologies and troubleshooting them
Experience/Skills with at least 2 of the following:
Routing concepts (with systems such as Linux/Cisco Routers and ASAs)
Experience with cloud servers and provisioning e.g. AWS EC2, Linode, Digital Ocean, etc.
Familiarity with monitoring frameworks like Nagios
Experience with Dev Ops tools such as Ansable
Backup and restore solutions
Scripting languages: Bash, Python, Ruby, PowerShell (1 or 2 of)
Cisco or Linux Certifications

Company Overview


Dematic is an intralogistics innovator that designs, builds and supports intelligent, automated solutions for manufacturing, warehouse and distribution environments for customers that are powering the future of commerce. With engineering centers, manufacturing facilities and service centers located in more than 25 countries, Dematic’s global network of 8,000 employees have helped achieve more than 6,000 worldwide customer installations for some of the world’s leading brands. Headquartered in Atlanta, Dematic is a member of KION Group, a global leader in industrial trucks, supply chain solutions and related services, and a leading provider of warehouse automation.

The Role


Dematic has an immediate need for a Controls Engineer with Conveyor/Sortation experience to join a team that performs complex audits of customer systems to improve their overall system effectiveness.

The Controls Engineer is responsible for the evaluation the controls aspects of customer systems for obsolescence, functionality, and condition. Specifically, this person will work as part of audit teams to evaluate automated systems, document findings/recommendations, and develop solutions to address current and future gaps.

Additionally, the Controls Engineer will work with the Customer Service Solution Development Group in preparing creative solutions and competitive estimates for Conveyor and Sortation Controls solutions related to Dematic and non-Dematic equipment.

Completes the design of complex systems that integrate hardware and software.

Optimize programs and parameters
Performs complex technical interchange and knowledge transfer for both processes and application of products to system design.

Performs full range of standard work for the professional field.
Refers complex, unusual problems to others.
Identifies and resolves more complex problems and applies problem-solving skills in order to deal with most situations.

Knowledge
Demonstrates and applies a broad knowledge of field of specialization through successful completion of moderately complex assignments.
Successfully applies complex knowledge of fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of particular area of specialization.
Demonstrates knowledge of organization's business practices and issues.
Material Handling Equipment background with a focus on Case, Pallet and Sorter Controls along with the ability to concept solutions and generate esitmates to support Sales requests. Also be proficient in Microsoft Products (Word, Excel, etc.).
Experience
Typically 5-8 years of successful experience in related field and successful demonstration of Key Responsibilities and Knowledge as presented above. Advanced degree MAY be substituted for experience, where applicable

Job Title: Sr. Electrical Engineer, EPC Projects Group
Job Description:
Ampirical is an electrical transmission and distribution engineering company that provides comprehensive customer support, from project conception to design engineering, project management, and construction.

Ampirical is seeking a substation engineer for its Operations Estimating group.

The Substation Engineer will work within a multi-discipline team to develop efficient and reliable preliminary design of electrical systems and components for Substation Facilities in accordance with applicable industry codes and standards. This Engineer will be accountable for developing preliminary substation electrical drawings in accordance with RFQ scope of work ensuring constructability of design. This position requires the individual to provide leadership, mentorship, and/or guidance to less experienced engineers within the department.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Deliver accurate designs of high voltage electrical substation components that meet industry and client standards and applicable codes.
Perform quality reviews of electrical engineering work for both peers/sub-contractors on assigned projects.
Act as lead Engineer and Engineer of Record for projects.
Design substation systems and components to include general arrangement, equipment, and electrical layout, grounding, bills of material, etc.
Prepare construction drawing preliminary packages for bids and review incoming proposals for alignment with design and constructability of methods.
Manage/development of project proposals, bid preparation, project schedules, etc. for assigned Substation projects.
Assist project team during construction on electrical substation issues.
Travel to client sites/field as necessary.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering from an ABET-accredited program.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in the engineering/design of electrical systems within the Utilities or Energy Industries.
Experience with ETAP, WinIGS, IEEE 88/998.
Active PE or the ability to acquire a PE within one year of employment is highly preferred.
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:

Ampirical offers an excellent benefits package including medical, dental, vision; STD, LTD, 401K; life insurance, gym stipend, tuition reimbursement, 10 paid holidays; two weeks' vacation; flexible work schedule (to possibly include every other Friday off) and more. Great opportunity for advancement; outstanding opportunity for career growth.

Other Requirements: Security Investigation, Drug/Alcohol Testing and Medical Examination, Adherence to AR (Army Regulation) 50-60, random drug and alcohol testing, Badge requirements
Project Background

The Pueblo Chemical Agent-Destruction Pilot Plant (PCAPP) will safely destroy 2,611 tons of mustard agent in mortar rounds and artillery projectiles stored at the U.S. Army Pueblo Chemical Depot (PCD) approximately 25 miles from Pueblo, Colorado. Neutralization followed by biotreatment is the technology selected by the Department of Defense to destroy the Pueblo chemical weapons stockpile. The PCAPP plant began the operations and munition destruction phase as of September 2016.

Candidates for unescorted access to the Chemical Limited Area must successfully clear National Agency Check with Local Check (NACLC). All employees are subject and agree to random drug and alcohol testing as a condition of employment. Must be physically fit and able to work safely at an operating plant. Eligible applicants must be a US Citizen and successfully go through a government screening process. Based on project goals and objectives, candidates established within our local community are desirable.

Role Overview
The Pueblo Chemical Agent-Destruction Pilot Plant (PCAPP) is looking for a Static Discharge Chamber (SDC) Cognizant Systems Engineer- Electrical to work the Pueblo, CO location. This position will report to the SDC Lead Cognizant System Engineer at the PCAPP project. The purpose of the Cognizant System Engineer (CSE) program, at PCAPP, is to ensure the continued operational readiness of the systems within its scope. One of the primary aspects of the CSE program is the designation of CSEs who are responsible for:
Maintaining overall knowledge and awareness of assigned systems
Providing systems engineering support for operations and maintenance
Technical support for ensuring continued system operational readiness
For each PCAPP system, the designated CSE will be the “System Owner". The responsibility of the CSE is to provide technical expertise and direction on a system to ensure the safe, efficient, and reliable performance of plant systems and components within the design and within environmental requirements, applicable codes and standards, approved procedures, and PCAPP policy. The CSEs have the primary responsibility to achieve resolution of technical issues and provide direction regarding their assigned system(s), utilizing Engineering Staff “discipline” expertise when required.

This is a long-term assignment with a 4-10s schedule. The work hours are from 6:30 am- 5:00 pm Monday- Thursday or Tuesday-Friday. Overtime hours will be required as deemed necessary. This position may also require employees to go on a dedicated DuPont Shift Schedule (up to 12 hours on at a time, rotating day and night shifts).

Principle responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

The successful candidates will be expected to perform the following duties of this position in the areas of electrical, instrumentation and control, mechanical, or fire protection, but are not necessarily limited to:

1. Configuration Management:
Understand system design and operation, including conformance to environmental, safety, and health requirements
Technical baseline maintenance
Engineered equivalency analysis
Monitor all capital improvement projects and recommend training programs as per requirement.
Demonstrate understanding of the following processes:
Maintenance Management
Work Control
Change Control
Document Control
Drawing Control
Conduct of Operations
Agent Safety
Limiting Conditions of Operations (LCOs)
Procurement, replacement, and related quality assurance requirements.
Working knowledge of the plant’s operation.
Vendor recommendations, manuals, and any product warnings.
Lead resolution of design issues necessary to support plant operations and/or maintenance
Review Project design and other documents for operations, maintenance, and testing impacts and provide alternative solutions for problems
Provide technical assistance in support of line management safety responsibilities and ensure continued system operational readiness
Ensure that system configuration is being managed effectively
Resource and Conservation Recovery Act (RCRA) and requirements.
Answering system(s) Nonconformance Reports.
Supporting permit modifications by attending any meetings and providing field walk downs, as required, with State of Colorado representatives.
2. Operations and Maintenance Support:
Maintain overall cognizance of the system and be responsible for system engineering support for operations and maintenance
Monitoring, tracking, and trending of assigned systems
Troubleshooting; root cause analysis
Recommend improvements to existing products.
Analyze all equipment requirements and assist in requisition of all tools and equipment.
Maintain and review daily logs and assist to resolve all issues and provide support to all engineering activities
Review and recommend improvements of all SOP and facility/system related procedures and perform troubleshooting on all plant activities and resolve all issues and assist facilities manager to implement all changes.
Evaluate all production activities and prepare reports for all activities and inspect all associate plant machines and equipment.
Initiate actions to correct problems
Remain cognizant of system-specific maintenance and operations history and industry operating experience, as well as manufacturer and vendor recommendations and any product warnings regarding their assigned systems
Providing technical support to Operations for their assigned system, which includes:
Providing technical advice to Operations to ensure their understanding of the need for operational requirements, as specified.
Supporting Operations personnel technical training on the assigned system(s).
Preparing for and supporting Operational Readiness Reviews (ORRs) and other testing activities.
Providing technical direction to Maintenance.
Developing and reviewing purchase requisitions for replacement and spare parts.
Assisting Maintenance in planning critical, unusual, or major maintenance activities.
Developing Preventative Maintenance (PMs) and job plans
Recommending changes in maintenance procedures based upon engineering evaluations of the trends observed.
Reviewing calibration procedures and records.
Conducting investigations during upset conditions.
Conducting long-range preparation and planning for future campaigns and reviewing identified campaigns for schedule improvements.
Providing around-the-clock support, as required.
Preparing contract Scope of Work (SOW), which includes:
Generating a detailed SOW and submitting it for field and document review and update, as required.
Attending pre-bid meetings and job-site visits, answering bidder questions, locating additional documentation needed to substantiate and answer bidder questions.
Interfacing with the subcontractor, attending in-progress review meetings, and providing additional information to the subcontractor, as required.
Performing final walk downs.
Coordinating with Operations, Maintenance, and the contractor on scheduling installation activities.
Reviewing and approving all submittals/material from subcontractor for accuracy.
3. The Electrical COG Engineer shall have these additional discipline specific expectations:
Provide Electrical system expertise on all plant electrical systems to include, main feeders, distribution systems, plant UPS systems and end user electrical components which may be assigned to other non-electrical systems.
Generate electrical system status, analysis and health reports

Read and diagnose thermal images of circuit breakers, electrical cabinets and transformers

Complete Facility lighting analyses to include conceptual formulation reviews, lamp type selection, luminaire selection
Provide technical support and expertise to offsite power supply utility as required.
Assist and support non-electrical system COGs with electrical issues with their systems
4. CSE Training and Qualification:
Complete required training and maintain qualifications associated with assignments.
The basic CSE qualification level includes prerequisite education and experience, training, familiarization with the PCAPP design, permitting and operational plans, and knowledge of processes and procedures applicable to CSE duties. Required reading is an important part of this qualification program and numerous required readings must be completed before satisfying the job requirements. The reading topics may not all be the same for all CSE qualification packages and are at the discretion of the Engineering Manager.
In addition to the basic CSE qualification level, PCAPP CSEs will be assigned one or more PCAPP systems for specific qualification. For system-specific requirements, the CSE must demonstrate detailed system‑specific knowledge including key technical requirements, design basis information, and system interfaces, and demonstrate an understanding of specific Safety and Regulatory assumptions/implications for operation of the system. Final evaluation will be done by oral interview assessment, system walk-down or a combination of the two.
A CSE is fully qualified for his/her system when he/she has obtained the basic and system-specific qualifications.

Westwood is a multi-disciplined national surveying and engineering services provider for commercial and residential development, public infrastructure, wind energy, solar energy, energy storage, and electric transmission projects.
